Review: Made this for a party and so many asked about it. They loved it. It went so quickly!
Great as is - it's tropical, fruity, and refreshing. I like to add Malibu rum too.
Added southern comfort as well which helped and used orange juice
I used champagne instead of a sparkling beverage. It was a fantastic kick! Made several batches for a small party, ran out within an hour!
Absolutely delicious! Everyone (even people who don't drink alcohol) loved it!!!
I've made this for several get-togethers, and it is always a hit. So refreshing.

I followed the recipe exactly and found that I had to add a bit more vodka for my guests. Still, it was MUCH easier than having to set up a bar with different tequila, bourbon, gin, rum, etc. + the mixers. Also, my punch container has a separate compartment for ice so it didn't get diluted.
Pretty basic, I used club soda instead of 7up and still very sweet

I made this for new years it was a hit! No one got too tipsy It has the right amount of vodka but I think I'll add a little more the next time I make it lol. If you like a sweet micrd drink then this punch is great!
This punch is a very popular treat at a local community event each year. We omit the vodka and all ages enjoy this punch.
I made this at my birthday party. Everyone loved it. I can't wait to make it again. Thanks so much for sharing.

Couldn't find pineapple juice concentrate so for both cans of frozen juice I substituted a pineapple-orange juice blend concentrate; used Sprite but no fresh fruit; recipe called for 12 oz. vodka but I used approx. 16-20 oz. My friends mostly liked it (although a little on the sweet side) but everyone agreed that it still didn't pack much of a punch. The high rating is for a simple yet decent punch that can be thrown together in a pinch w/a few inexpensive ingredients. Lots of potential for it to be doctored up w/different fun ingredients.
Served at Super Bowl party and everyone loved it
We made it for our Christmas party and that was the only cocktail friends wanted to drink!

Just made this for a small party! The cherries didn't stay afloat bcz of my punch container but it is tasty! I used pineapple passion flavored vodka and I cudnt find frzn pineapple concentrate so I used Goya nectar n I got 2 cans of pineapple passion fruit nectar. I think it cud have used a bit more vodka! Lol

Great for summer parties. If you like strong drinks I would suggest using 2.5 cups of vodka. One orange cut into rounds will suffice. If you have left over oranges and cherries after the party, pour a little vodka and let them soak and you have jungle juice.
Made this punch for NYE 2014. Everyone loved it, said it tasted like Skittles. I used Smirnoff Vanilla Vodka. Be careful, the teens will sneak and drink it too!
Alcohol content not enough, I wanted my crowd to get slightly buzzed, but it did not happen bacause it was diluted so much from the other juices in the recipe.

Made this punch for a Summer BBQ/Birthday party on a very hot day!! Used a large can of Dole Pineapple Juice, a bottle of O.J., doubled the amount of vodka and used one 2 liter of sprite and some grenadine syrup, to give it some color. It was delicious and a major hit with my guests! Will make again!
Yummy!!! Popular choice for ladies' parties.
All I can say is YUM!

Good quick easy punch. I didn't have frozen concentrated pineapple juice and just used a 46oz can of pineapple juice instead. Also I ended up only using 1 1/2 (2 liter bottles) bottles of 7-up instead of 2. (because we like it sweet) Went great with Christmas dinner! Will make again.
Love this! I used this recipe for my Bunco party. The girls loved it. It was delicious and not too strong so we were able to finish the game...No "Drunko" here! It will be used often!
really good punch

Fabulous Punch! I made this for our annual July 4th party and it was a big hit! I doubled it and used a liter of vodka (these people like to party).... I mixed everything in a 5 Liter Igloo beverage dispenser and served it with orange slices and skewered pinapple and maraschino cherries. Very refreshing, but be careful because this stuff goes down way to easy...

This punch is always a huge hit. I add way more vodka because you cannot taste it, and instead of oranges and cherries, I add frozen berries to the punch. Costco sells a bag of mixed frozen berries, or other times I add a couple of bags of frozen raspberries. This punch is so good and you will get many compliments !!
I served this at bunco and it was a huge hit. The women loved it!

This was awesome! This is gonna be my favorite go to punch of all time! Compared to other punches this so easy and economical as well for a big crowd. Made it for a party we threw and my husband who drinks mostly beer loved this. You cannot even tast the alcohol. We did get tipsy on this but I think it's cause we were drinking it sooo fast! Thanks so much for this recipe! Will definitely make this for Super bowl for the girls. =0)
Very sweet, not very strong. This punch is good for people who may want something different than wine or beer at a gathering

Great Punch! Doubled the alcohol and also had to makeshift a second Batch since it disappeared so quick. 2nd Batch I used Mango-Orange Juice Concentrate and Pink Lemonade Concentrate and actually thought it was better because it wasn't so sweet.

Made this for a party and this went really fast! I couldn't find frozen pineapple juice so I used bottled and worked just the same. This sneaks up on ya bc it is so good and can't tast the vodka. Oranges and cherries made it great for presentation. Everyone at my luau party loved it!

Made this for a "filler" drink at a martini party, just in case anyone didn't like martinis. Well, this entire this was downed and people were turning the punch bowl on it's side trying to get every last drop out. Can't wait to make again!!!

Yummy! Only draw back is you can't really leave it out for long because the soda goes flat. I made the juice part and added the soda to each glass instead of mixing it all together. I also added at least twice as much alcohol and you still could barely taste it. Thanks!
i made this non-alcoholic for my husband's birthday party.everyone loved it.delicious

I made this delicious punch for a Baby Shower a few weeks ago, it was gone within 30 mins. Everyone kept asking what exactly I put it in and when will I make another batch. I have added this recipe to my list of MUST HAVE beverages for entertainment parties I host- which are weekly.
Made this for a party and substituted Malibu Rum in place of the Vodka and everyone loved it...it was a HUGE hit!
I loved this punch and it does not need any changes. This punch goes really quickly, because it is so good.

I've made this simple but delicious punch for every Christmas party I've hosted over the past 6 years since finding it here, and it's always a hit. It's now a standard at my bar set-up, along with other pop & mixers, beer and wine. I split it into two batches -- one spiked and one virgin, and don't bother with the punch bowl, I just use large pitchers. My only warning is to pour the pop in small batches and don't stir it too much, as the carbonation seems to react with the juice concentrate and really fizzes up a lot. I had a sticky mess to clean up the first time -- learned my lesson after that. Great punch - definitely recommend!
A little to sweet for me but it was all gone by the end of my party!
This was a huge hit at our last party! I will definitely make it again. I made it exactly as the recipe states and it was delicious.
Very Good. I made a few changes. I used Vanilla flavored vodka and 1 bottle of soda.
my husband and I made this punch For a new years eve party I loved it and so did our guests will be making again
Made for a cookie decorating party and got rave reviews. Added some cranberry juice for extra tartness and color. Yum!
Very good. It was a hit at the party

I have used this recipe many, many times now for parties, and it's always a great hit. If you're a college student or twentysomething like me (or just like to drink), I suggest doubling the amount of vodka. The flavor is still great!
Very tasty! However, I didn't feel it packed the punch some other reviewers have stated. It went fast, though!
This recipes was quick, easy and very good! I was able to throw it together in less then five minutes. My friends and I loved it!

I made this for a party this weekend - turned out wonderfully! I had to keep reminding the ladies at the party that it had alcohol in it - no one could even tell. I received a bunch of compliments on it. I will DEFINITELY be making this again.
I made this punch for my Dad's retirement party and everybody loved it!

We hosted a murder mystery party and the guests LOVED this. We added some blackberry brandy to give it a little extra kick. We had no punch left over (and we made a double batch) and everyone said that you could not hardly taste the alcohol...which in turn made everyone really tipsy, however that was the intension =)
This is a great summer punch. I cut the sugar in half or more to taste. The full 2 cups makes i too sweet.

This punch was the hit of our holiday party. We are social drinkers, though, and felt there wasn't nearly enough Vodka so the bottle was left out with a shot glass near the punch bowl for guests to add their more to their own. Another friend made this a few weeks later, omitting the Vodka completely from the punch bowl but also left out the bottle of Vodka and the shot glass for those who wanted that extra kick.
This was all that and very easy to make. Taste so good. I froze the orange slices before adding to the punch. 5+++
Thought it was great!
YUM! So easy to make and so delicious!! But be careful...you don't taste the vodka at all!!! We loved it at my New Years party!
Used only 1 2-liter but was still very good
This is such a tasty punch. I made it for my mom's birthday party and everyone loved it. I now keep the ingredients on hand to make a smaller batch whenever company comes over.
Awesome punch! I added just a smidget of grenadine for a baby shower. Everyone ranted and raved over this punch.
It was a hit at a party I threw over the weekend. I ommitted the cherries and added a container of Sherbert.
Made it for an office party - it was a big hit!
I made this for a small get together and everybody loved that you couldn't taste the alcohol and that it had a zippy flavor. I am making it tonight for a party we are throwing.
Wow! Made a great jungle juice (a drink where you taste no liquor what so ever)and it was gone before the party was even over! Thanks for a great reciepe!
IT WAS FAST AND EASY TO MAKE. MY FAMILY LOVED DRINKING IT ON NEW YEARS EVE.
I served this recipe for our reception and it was a hit!

I made this and because a full blender of ice is so much volume it diluted it to a very weak taste. I made it again and blended the fluid first and kept adding ice cubes until I got the thick consistency without any excess ice. Note I froze the glass blender pitcher first and the glass mug. Keeps it frozen longer
Very sour and sweet. Not enjoyable at all.

Honestly this was an easy simple, YUMMY recipe for a margarita!! Definitely my new go to! I found it easiest to use the limeade container as my measure, dump limeade in, fill container all the way with tequila- dump, then fill container 1/2 way with triple sec- dump, add ice and I also added 2 scoops of orange concentrate.... big hit at the party and went down smooth!!
Was great but I used Grand Marnier Cordon Rouge liqueur instead of Triple Sec!
Overall this is very easy and a pitcher of Margaritas is always good, but it is just way too sweet.

Ok...If you like Margaritas this is the Top & U really should try it.... AMAZING is better than just good... Will be using this from now on at home... I prefer Patron... So I can talk about this tequila....I did as a reviewer suggested putting remaining in ice cube trays for later and wouldn’t change anything....
Simple and delicious! Just need a better blender.
It was delicious I added a bit of orange juice as described in other reviews! Best yet
I just made this and it is delicious and STRONG!! This will be my go to recipe even just over ice!! Though over ice I might add some water.
Perfect!
BEST RECIPE EVER! Triple Batch for 10 Women. Added fresh lime on rim of glasses and dipped in Salt. Delish
WILL MAKE IT AGAIN!! So good! Why would anyone buy Margarita Mix??
This was perfect and strong. I used Grand Mariner instead of triple sec. I will use this as the base for my margaritas from now on ... but I’ll invest in triple sec.
This margarita recipe is awesome! Easy and delicious!

I didn't like this as it tasted too bitter. It needed a touch of sweetness added to it, like lemonade or something. I used a reposado and Grand Marnier. I made a better mix myself by crushing lime slices and mint leaves, then adding ice, lime cordial, tequila, lemonade and a touch of soda water. This was just far too bitter and it was missing something that made it nice to drink.

I didn't like this as it tasted too bitter. It needed a touch of sweetness added to it, like lemonade or something. I used a reposado and Grand Marnier. I made a better mix myself by crushing lime slices and mint leaves, then adding ice, lime cordial, tequila, lemonade and a touch of soda water. This was just far too bitter and it was missing something that made it nice to drink.
Made as written - tasty!
As was mentioned....just as is....perfect
Made it just the way the recipe says and I loved it. So did my friend who I shared with.

I took the advice of measuring everything in the limeaide can and the taste was awesome! Fill the empty can three-fourths full of Tequila and then fill the rest of the can up with Triple Sec. You can’t go wrong.
We all LOVE this recipe, especially on a hot day. Today I added a handful of frozen (picked up on the mountain last week) huckleberries to the mix and it turned out even better!
Made as directed Yum!
I normally don't like frozen margaritas but these are FANTASTIC!! Thank you so much for sharing! These are soooo good and really hit the spot when cooling off from this insanely hot summer!
Could not be easier and was a crowd pleaser! Absolutely will use this recipe again but for two I may use fresh squeezed limes.

These are so good! We took our blender camping! Camping! That’s how good. Lol! I did notice a difference in taste depending on which brand limeade you use. Definitely pay the price and get the more expensive kind.
Perfection!!
Fast easy fun and yummy
yummy
This recipe was not good at all!
Made with OJ and fresh lime.. Awesome! Husband said, "Dang babe! That's good!" He isn't even a margarita guy.
Easy to make and not too sweet like like the margarita mixes. I’ll be drinking these all summer!
Basic, simple, tastes fantastic.

Excellent!! Except I don't like blended margaritas so we just did the recipe as directed but add 1 cup bottled margarita mix( because we had it??!!) Pour into glasses over ice and add salt rims and limes and Viola!!! YUMMMY!!!
Very easy to make!!!
I add cherries and grenadine! I love this recipe!!
Love this! Make it regularly. We are light weights so only use half the alcohol. Excellent!
Simple to make, refreshing, and effective. Added a little OJ but otherwise made as written.
The best frozen margarita I have ever tasted! Always a hit !
Excellent! Loved this version. This is actually a recipe my mother used to make. When I was a kid she made virgin ones for us (frozen limeade!)
Excellent!
Made it using a 12oz can of limeade, a 12 oz can of Wildberry punch concentrate, 12oz tequila, 4oz triple sec, and 12 oz water...mix and serve over rocks...
We had a fun afternoon after a couple of these :-) we didn't have triple sec so used OJ instead, still delicious though, thanks.

Making it as is is nice, flavorful and not too sweet. I think this one was easier to make than using the Bacardi mix because you have to add stuff to it. This is 3 simple ingredients, with variations available if you want a change of pace. Ain't broke, don't need fixin' my hubby says...just like in Mexico!

Always a crowd-pleaser for guests! I've made these margaritas many times, and follow the recipe closely. If inclined, I'll add the juice of a lime (or two) and if I'm serving my mother-in-law, I'll generally add a few splashes of Sprite or Squirt. I love mine with a salted rim and a couple slices of fresh lime. Nothing better than sittting on your patio on a warm, sunny day with one of these tasty concoctions in hand!
It was perfect! I wouldn't make any changes.
The recipe I always use - guests love it!
Super easy and sooo good. Very adaptable to your personal tastes. For us, we used 6oz limeade, 4 oz tequila, 2oz triple sec, splash of OJ and 1tbsp sugar. They were yummy!!
Very easy to make but something is missing. I think it's juice of lime.
Great margarita, will not buy margarita mix ever again.
Impossible to beat for simplicity and taste. This is a great party margarita, especially for those that prefer frozen to on-the-rocks.
Came out great!

This is pretty much the only way I make margaritas now, it's so easy and tastes so much better than premade mixes. Add in a little squeeze of fresh lime to make it even better! I'm probably made this at least 10 times by now
Made these on the rocks instead of frozen. Yum!
Delicious. Not a drop was left.
I have made this recipe for years and it is the best ever!!!!!!!!!!!!
Perfect!
Love it! So many compliments every time I make it. I use Grand Marnier in place of triple sec. Excellent!!!
This recipe is a big hit when friends come for my patio happy hour! It's delicious as is or add a splash of OJ as suggested by other reviewers, which made it even better.
So easy and delicious! Will make again!

I thought the original recipe seemed like an awful large batch and I was only making these for two so, I halved the triple sec and limeade and used 4 ounces of tequila and filled the blender ¾ full of ice. I added a couple pinches of fresh lime zest and they were AMAZING! A little boozy, but not too strong, and the flavor was fantastic!
Was a little bitter for my taste, but I added just a little sugar and they were perfect for my taste.
nobody cared for htis.
Love this recipe! I double it and make it in my Vitamix and add jalapeño peppers. Awesome!
OMG! Mondays are my new Fridays with this drink!
Delicious i used 1/2 a can of oj in place of the triple sec.

Have used this recipe for years but got smart and started making out own Limade Concentrate.` 1 1/2 c splenda 1 1/2 c water(u dont have to heat like simple syrup when you use splenda) 1c lime juice,and bottled lime juice tastes just as good.(actually we harly ever freeze it we keep a pitcher made up in the bar fridge.Large BATCH 6 c splenda,6c water and 4 cups of lime juice
These are amazing!!! Didn't change one thing. Yum!
So simple, easy, and absolutely delicious!!
So good!! Wouldn't change anything
Best recipe ever!!

Finally found the perfect mix.... the 2 ounces of triple sec make all the difference! Though a floater of Grand Marnier doesn't hurt either. Thank you for making ME the one that everyone remembers for the fabulous margaritas!

Made these using the limeade container to measure the tequila and triple sec. 3/4 full with tequila and the rest with triple sec. They came out perfect! Thank you for the easy recipe! My freezer is now stocked with limeade!! =))
The perfect frozen margarita!
The perfect frozen margarita!

Exactly what I wanted! We did have to add extra Tequila, you really cant go wrong with a little extra tequila . I been looking for a new margarita recipe for years and now this is my go to! Taste so awesome -Gen-ERIC

I'm always looking for good "clone" recipes for my favorite things. I'm not a big frozen margarita fan, but love a good margarita on the rocks. I found the frozen limeade mix at Kroger, the Kroger brand, and it was in 12oz. can's. I doubled the recipe with a good blanco tequila and cointreau instead of triple sec. I added about 3 1/2 cans of filtered water in the limeade container. I added a splash of orange juice to finish it. It is OUT OF THIS WORLD!! I would have never imagined! I am totally sharing this recipe with family and friends. SO glad to have found this recipe and tweaked it for my liking ??
HOLY COW these are dangerously delicious! Used the recipe as is and they were a hit at the Mexican themed dinner party I had. Thank you for sharing this!
AWESOME! Fresh margaritas. Easy to make. Everyone raved about them!
Very Good

I'm very picky about my margaritas and I don't usually drink frozen margaritas. But these were Soooo tasty and super easy to make! From now on, I will definitely keep frozen limeade in my freezer for the purposes of making these margaritas.

You also need 6 ounces of beer, and change the triple sec to 6 ounces. That makes it perfect. If you can find the 6 ounce can of limeade, dump the limeade in, then refill the can with the last three ingredients because they are all 6 ounces.
Great simple recipe. Thanks!!!
Very good recipe for homemade Margaritas!

So good and so easy. Can't seem to find 6-oz containers of limeade any more so, darn it, I'm forced to use the 12-oz container and double everything else. Also add a few ounces of fresh orange juice. After blending without ice, pour into a pitcher and keep in the refrigerator. Then when making a drink just add ice to the blender and whatever amount you want of the mix. Great for unexpected guests or just me enjoying the evening garden!

Made this for a game night we hosted and I was rather surprised how well it went over... We finished several batches... Definitely will add to cocktail rotation for parties... Easy and no clean up!!! Ps. Holds up well in freezer!

I made 3 batches of this drink, put them in a covered plastic bucket (Ice cream container) and stuck them in the freezer, thinking they would last all weekend with my relatives around. We scooped them easily into Margarita glasses right out of the freezer. Ha! We ended up making more and everyone wanted the easy recipe for themselves. Very yummy, very simple and better than any bottled Margarita I've tried. A keeper and this summer's go to cool off drink.
Perfect! Added a smidge of OJ as reviewer suggested.
We love these. It kicks your butt tho! Make sure you don't have to drive.

I have been looking for a simple margarita recipe and this is the one!! It is absolutely delicious. The change I made, per reviewers suggestions, is I used Grand Marinier instead of triple sec. My daughter is training to be a bartender and she said it was as good as the one they make at the Country Club where she is working for summer. Thank you for posting it.
This is an excellent recipe! My boyfriend made half of a batch last night & it was perfect.

Tasted better than the bottled mix versions but packs a punch. :). I bought a strawberry/banana smoothie to add in and it was delicious. I added a full beer (Modelo) to tone down the sweetness. Also bought guava and mango juice so whatever flavor you want goes with this recipe. Will use a little less alcohol next time.

Been using limeade for many years. Prefer on the rocks - so I make the limeade as directed on the can then add the liquors to a pitcher. Also there is a liqueur called Gran Gala that is much less expensive than Grand Marnier or Cointreau. A slash of OJ or a splash of beer (yes, beer) also tastes yummy!
My first attempt at Margaritas. So yummyo!!! And super easy...I like easy!!
OMG..... Are you kidding me? 3 ingredients & ice. This is by far the best margarita I've ever had. I was drinking this out of the blender. Will b making my own from now on...lol.
Tastes great and very easy to make. Dangerous combo! :)
The honest-to-God BEST margaritas!! Be careful, they are dangerously addictive. So much better than any margarita mix, the limeade and triple sec are the perfect balance to the tequila.

I was former pastry chef and I got shorbet or ice cream maker at my workshop,I'd love swap 6 ounce of squeezed lemon juice and sugar + half water.ex 500ml lemon juice 500gr sugar and 250gr water and just put it into those machine)of lime concencrate as same amount with fresh lemon shorbet(mix same amount,you can make it in lot quantity and save it for later.and I also used 7 oz tequila but just 1 oz of triple sec.

So easy and delicious. Be sure to crush the ice before blending if you have a cheap-o blender like I do, so you don't get huge chunks of ice. But the flavor was actually really great. Might try some agave nectar next time. Also, a squeeze of fresh lime juice and maybe a splash of OJ really brightens it up and it's so much better than squeezing a million fresh limes for each drink! I've stocked up on a big quality bottle of the tequila I prefer, a big bottle of Cointreau and a few containers of brand name limeade concentrate, for the ease of it. I'm always on the front porch now that the weather's warm and it's always classy to be able to offer a cold drink. If you're not a margarita snob, definitely try this easy, yummy recipe! This is my go-to margarita recipe if I'm feeling lazy. :)
We love this recipe! This is our go to Margarita. Put everything in our Ninja blender and wa la and a great quick drink. Beats the Barcardi mix and easier on the pocket book.

I worked for Mexican restaurant and I thought they have the best margarita, butt I was in a bind with the neighborhood garage sale, so I run into the house and found this recipe, my jaws dropped and my neighbors where so delightful everyone keep asking for more. I just add and ounce of Grand Marnier and voila!!! that was Cadillac margarita
Best Margaritas EVER.... if I could give 10 stars I would!!! Easy and delicious.
Super easy & the tastiest by far!!!!

We used to make these forty years ago, but we always added a juice can of water as well and put it in the freezer so it stayed nice and slushy. We did the same thing with 1 juice can of lemonade, 1 of whiskey, and one of water and called them Whiskey Sours. Way too sweet for me now, though.

Wow this was great. I am not a huge tequila fan but I was pleasantly surprised by the smooth flavor. I will definitely use this again. For myself I might make it a little weaker but for company I am sure this will be a hit!!! Thanx again for a great recipe.
love the ease of the recipe, and it taste great.
My husband thinks I'm a genius. Great margurita.
Very good. I added the little bit of OJ and tasted even better
Very easy and my friends raved about them. Thanks!

Preferred ratios of tequila : orange liquor : lime juice aside, any recipe that doesn't use fresh squeezed lime juice won't taste right. Also, most triple sec is mostly corn syrup or sugar. Use Cointreau, Grand Marnier or any orange liqueur or triple sec that has at least 30% alcohol.

Have been making margaritas this way for over 25 years. All of our guests love them, and so do we! Easy to play around with using other fruit----such as watermelon! Use a melon baller, and freeze the watermelon. When you make the margaritas, the frozen watermelon acts as the ice cubes, too. [Will probably need to add some sugar or Splenda if watermelon isn't too sweet.]
A+++++ Can't go wrong with this recipe!
Easy and delicious. Great for summertime cookouts and with Mexican food.
PERFECT!
not a "purist" recipe, but perfect for a crowd!!
Amazing!!! Everytime I make this drink I get request to make more. Love it.
A friend gave me this recipe with one variation: she adds a 1/2 beer bottle into it. It is her family's recipe and it was great at my parties!
I have the best margarita recipe EVER! Patron Anejo tequila Grand Marnier liqueur Triple Sec Lime juice (fresh squeezed - you sweeten to you liking) Frozen or on the boulders, baby! Salute mi amigos!
Super easy and super good! I also added a bit of ice to make it a bit more slushie.

Easiest and best margaritas ever! I cut back on the tequila and triple sec just for personal preference, and I also add a little agave syrup and the juice of one orange and a couple limes. I add the ice last and blend to a slush. YUMMY!
Perfect recipe- I always hated the store bought mixes- glad I found this one! Wouldn't make it any other way!!!

All of our guests preferred these when they were made with 4 oz of tequila in lieu of the called for 6 oz. With that modification, these would rate 5 stars from me. These were very good and very easy to make. No more pre-made mix for me! Thanks for sharing this recipe, Katherine!
Surprisingly wonderful! This is so simple but delicious. I used Geand Marnier rather than triple sec nice I had it on hand.
Soooooo tasty! We opted for adding a touch more tequila :)
Delicious margaritas, as good as any restaurant. I always get rave reviews from guests.
This is THE BEST!!! And so easy.
Great recipe. I doubled the tequila and they were perfect.
These were wonderful! A little strong for our taste, as written, so when we made a second batch we put 2 oz. less tequila and it was great. Floated a shot of Blue Curacao on top - amazing! :)
I just made this recipe with a couple changes from other reviews. Delicious. What I also like is that you can calculate for a big crowd. Love this feature.
Excellent! Super easy and better + less expensive than the premade mixes. Took a suggestion from another review and added a little OJ - perfect! Thanks for this great recipe!
Made these over the weekend, followed recipe exactly and they are deelish. Will be making them again for the 4th of July weekend. Try this, you won't be disappointed.

This recipe was AMAZING!! I don' think that I will try another recipe ever! I was the right amount of flavor with the right amount of alcohol without being too much. I made it straight, but you could easily add fruit if you choose. Thanks!!

excellent recipe..!! i did not know it was so simple.. i made it for my first wedding anniversary. none of my friends could believe their ears when I told them i made the margaritas.. my mom was taken aback.. thank you for giving this good recipe. i shared each stage of the making with my friend who stays abroad as and when I made it.. both of us made it simultaneously..

I used regular ice cubes since I don't have crushed, and it turned out fine. These are the only margaritas I've had so far, so I can't compare them to others or fully judge, but they were pretty good, and soooo easy.
Fantastic! Took some advise from the other reviews and added a little bit of orange juice and lime juice. This one's a keeper!
Easy to make and excellent!
Great!!! We made these margaritas for our Cinco de Mayo party and everyone enjoyed them.
Perfect recipe. Easy and simple and the guests love it.
Perfect, best margarita I've had, a huge success!

Everyone said they loved this margarita! It had that nice bite that you get from a restaurant drink. I used Simply Lime (not from concentrate/not frozen) Limeade. I also added 2 ounces of orange juice. Blended this in the Margaritaville blender, and garnished with limes and oranges... perfect :-) I also used it as a base for the strawberry margaritas. I used the same proportions, but instead of tequila, I used strawberry rum, and added frozen strawberries (and garnished with a strawberry). Our guests were quite impressed!

Fabulous! It would be 4 stars as shown, but 5 stars for how we did it. Made as directed but included a couple of additional suggestions from Cooper: added a scoop of frozen pineapple concentrate to the mix and then floated a tiny bit of Grand Marnier on top. As good as - no, better than! - any margarita I've ever had. (Making it as shown was a bit too sour for us - the pineapple was the perfect antidote. OJ would be good too but I didn't have that on hand.) It was a verrrrry good party! :)
This is a really good margarita! It is my new favorite. Happy Cinco De Mayo!

If you're really intent on using the can for ease of purpose, then do it this way to get it right: fill the can full with tequila, dump that in and then fill it 1/3 full with triple sec. Tada! Instant recipe and the ratio really is good.
Awesome signed Boopsie
Wow-tastes like it came from a professional bartender! I also tried it "on the rocks" rather than frozen-equally great. Outstanding-a keeper-thank you for sharing!!
a keeper, I m not going back to Jose Cuervo. I added OJ . and you can also added some beer it's call bee-rita

This is the closest I've ever been able to get to the margaritas that I get at a Mexican restaurant. This recipe is a keeper for me!! I recommend using 3/4 of a container of limeade instead of the whole 6 oz, it was a little too sweet when we used the whole container.

These taste just like the margaritas you get from the Mexican restaurant! We made them blended and on the rocks and we liked them on the rocks better! Added the juice of a lime when making them on the rocks and upped the triple sec by one shot! Thanks for the recipe!
SO delicious! I served these at a party and everyone loved them. Using frozen limeade is so much tastier than sour mix.
This was so freakin easy and good that I'm mad. Mad I've been paying way to much to overpriced bars for margys

I've been making these for a few years the exact same way except I use simply limeade in the clear plastic jug in the fresh OJ aisle instead of frozen concentrated limeade. The only difference is simply limeade uses sugar instead of high fructose corn sugar used in most frozen limeade. Either way, these are great. Also, you can splurge and use Cointreau instead of Triple Sec for a "Deluxe" version of this cocktail.
Great margaritas!!!! Made them for a girls only superbowl party and everyone couldnt get enough of them. Didn't make any changes, terrific as is!!
Very nice, very easy.
Never again will I bother squeezing a bunch of (expensive) limes to make margaritas. This was delicious and dead easy. Look no further.
These were so easy to make! Just as easy as buying the mix but tasted so much better! I got many compliments on these at my girls' night out.
Awesome!! you will not regret this.
Hot summer day. Margarita in hand. Need I say more? Perfect.

Mexico in a glass YUM YUM YUM - i sprinkle salt inside with the blender instead of putting it on the rim of the glass (not as messy). I haven't seen a 6 oz can of limeade though :P these just taste sooooo good! I would never attempt to find another recipe anywhere else because this is just perfect.

These were really good margaritas. I think they're pretty sweet, but I think margaritas in general isn't something that I can personally drink all night long. I had a party though and my one cousin took care of the pitcher! I will for sure make these again for guests. And maybe do some tweeking next time to see if I can make it a little less sweet. Great & easy recipe though for sure!

Defintely the best way. Been doing it for years and people always comment about mine being the best. I dump out about a fourth of the limeade though so the tartness/sweetness is not overwhelming. 1 cup teq., 1/4 cup trip. sec, as much ice as you can get in blender until it stops moving, then pour a little water in if necessary to get it barely moving again. Salt on rim and lime wedge. As 'Cajun Man' would say, "perfecshone!"
too much lime concentrate
Excellant! Easy Easy! I made 16 servings and still ran out!!! My advice... by extra limeade because people will come back for seconds and thirds on this one!!

I thought these were good, but my husband and I found them to be too syrupy or sugary with the lime concentrate. I also added some frozen peaches to tone it down. I think I'll try fresh lime juice next time. Thank you!
Super easy and great tasting. I used another person's suggestion and filled the limeade container 3/4 with tequila and 1/4 of triple sec.
For ease and speed you can’t beat it, but you can tell it wasn’t made with fresh limes which I prefer. It’s still very refreshing, just don’t skimp on the crush ice.
I wanted something that was better than the traditional margarita mix and this is WAY better!
I wanted something that was better than the traditional margarita mix and this is WAY better!

I do not like blended margaritas so I'm wondering if I should try adding some water so it's not so syrupy(half and half with the limeade concentrate?). I've tried a version of this with Simply Limeade (bottle of ready to drink limeade) but it was way too watered down.
The best I've ever made!

I was nervous to try to make margaritas without the ole trusty margarita mix -- but did it (even with company over!) and was so impressed. Were VERY good, and am happy to say i will NOT be buying the mix any more!! Great tasting, very easy....

Truly the best margaritas we've ever made around here! I make it just as directed (only occasionally adding a *bit* more booze, depending on my company!), and it is perfect! The splash of orange juice comment is good, if you like the drink sweeter. I now stock up on limeade when I find it cheap just for this recipe! Everyone loves these!
Da best margaritas eva!! Yeah I've been drinking one!
fabulous! Easy and delicious.

So easy and tasty, a real hit! I also did as one person suggested and filled the limeade container 3/4 with tequila and 1/4 with triple sec. Then filled the blender with crushed ice last and voila, fantasticness!

I do the same exact thing here in this recipe but I also add Patron orange liqueur about 1 oz. I cut up some lime slices and use one to squeeze on the rim before adding sea salt to the rim and then put a lime wedge either on the rim or inside the drink for added lime flavor and it rocks!!!

Man, this recipe has nailed it. These margaritas are perfect every time. I make it when company comes over, and I've even doubled and tripled the recipe (mixed in separate batches), poured it into my gallon-sized tupperware pitcher, and brought it to pool parties and bbqs. They get rave reviews every time, and people are always amazed by the simplicity of the recipe. This is a definite winner!
I agree with the addition of orange juice and fresh lime juice! Also, if you reduce the limeade and add a container of fresh raspberries, it makes a delicious raspberry margarita!!

This is an all around great margarita. We use this recipe at the pub I work in for about 12 years now and its foolproof. I add many things like the first poster said to change it up a bit.Very versatile to use. I make it double strength for home and freeze it and make a shush to add to more limeade. I love to add some fresh mint as well, and I zest an orange and add that as well. Skies the limit with this one. You can definately make it your own.
Simply perfect. What margaritas should taste like.
Very good! It will be a favorite.

I have made this same margarita recipe for more than 25 years, time tested.. most Mexican restaurant Margaritas can't even compare to this one! If you want to kick it up a a few notches, use Gran Marnier instead of triple sec.. amazing!!!!
Holy Moly :) I'm on my second glass now!!! These are so delicious and easy to make. There are no changes that need to be made IMO.
I'm Addicted to these! Ever since I made these the first time, I can't stop. SOOO good.
Instead of triple sec, use Grand Marnier! And always use 100% agave tequila and a squeeze of lime. You'll never go back to any other margarita!
Really easy, really good! Thanks
Yum. Big hit, especially with a floater of raspberry liqueur. Will make again.
Easy and very good. Some reviewers thought they were on the strong side. I thought they were perfect!
Excellent recipe!! I followed the bartenders suggestions adding a couple ounces of fresh squeezed orange juice and grand marnier! FANTASTIC!! From now on this is my EXCLUSIVE margarita recipe!

Wow! I just made this to try it for future parties. I scaled everything back for just one drink. 1 oz limeade, 1 oz tequila and a splash of triple sec. Poured it over crushed ice and I am in heaven! Thank you so much for such a delicious and easy recipe!
Follow the directions, NOT the reviews on this one! I made several batches of this last night, including guava margaritas and pineapple margaritas. So easy and delish!
A-MAZE-ING! Yum YUM! I took the bartender's suggestion and added the half oz. oj and some fresh squeezed lemon juice. This is a very refreshing drink. I don't think I can go back to mixes.
Easy, less expensive & pretty good...I just think the Triple Sec kinda overpowers a little & brings out the "limeade" flavor a bit too much...Tastes much better with just 1 ounce Triple sec......
This margarita was absolutely AMAZING! I dont usually like margaritas but I loved this one. Everyone I served loved it and wanted the recipe. Thank you!
This margarita was absolutely AMAZING! I dont usually like margaritas but I loved this one. Everyone I served loved it and wanted the recipe. Thank you!
Excellent margaritas, celebrating Cinco de Mayo a day late and this hit the spot!
best margarita I've ever had! My husband made this for us. We're celebrating cinco de mayo (just another excuse to drink...lol) and thought we'd festively have these. YUM! Dangerously good.
Delish! Ive never liked bottled mixes but I was really craving a margarita when I found this and Im so glad I did. No more bottled mixes in this house!
I love this recipe as well. I add to it one bottle of corona beer. Everyone seems to enjoy them. don't forget the salt!
Excellent! After years of winging it with other recipes, I finally tried this one over the weekend and it was spectacular!
Too funny, Katherine. This is the SAME way I've made mine for years. My friends call these Joanne's margaritas and wow, do they pack a punch!
this recipe was very good and had a great flavor I think it is one of the best drinks to serve at a party your hosting or just an adult gathering
I always use frozen limeade as every label I've read on Margarita mix is loaded with High Fructose Corn Syrup.

I've used this recipe for years; it is great! My son taught me a couple of tricks, which may sound odd, but do try them as they add a little something extra - add some beer to the blender and/or add a couple of spearmint leaves. You will be amazed!
These were great margaritas. Don't know what I can say that already hasn't been said except I didn't think they were to sweet -matter of fact I added a little more triple sec.
Really good! I added water because I made mine on the rocks. Really good and way better than with the bottled mix.

Perfection! My huband and I used to go to this chain Tex-Mex place 2 or 3 times a week! Food so-so but the margarita's were to die for! Sadly, restaurant closed and I never could find that fantastic margarita again. Well guess what? This is it! Made it exactly to recipe, loaded the salt on the rim (what can I say, I like salt) and presto! Perfect Margarita! Thank you!! Trying out at party tomorrow night. Can't wait for the reviews!!
these are the best just made some yum yum

This was an amazing margarita using the tip from Cooper. We added a little shot bottle that was $1.25 at the liquor store (didn't want to buy a whole bottle) to the blender and it made all the difference in the world. Amazing!
best best BEST margarita recipe EVER!
This was awesome. I followed someone else's instructions for measuring. 3/4can tequila and 1/4 can triple sec! YUM-E!!
I followed the recipe exactly and they are awesome! I will never buy margarita mix again.
So delish, better than any restaurant marg I have had! Quick and easy too.
Loved it! It was so easy, and everyone loved it!

Made this recipe for my New Years eve party. Used generic frozen limeade concentrate and 1800 Tequila Reposada. Only made one change - substituted Triple Sec with Grand Gala (Italian version of Grand Marnier). Liquid gold! Wasn't too strong but not weak either. ;)

I have been making these margaritas for over 20 years! Love them! I do want to throw in here stat I add a TBS of granulated sugar. If I want to make strawberry, I use the frozen sliced strawberries (for smoothies) and cut down on the ice. And if you are wanting to make a "kid" batch, just substitute the tequila and triple sec with orange juice. They love to have a cocktail too!
Yum. Easy. That's all I'm saying.
Easy and Awesome!
Easy and delicious!
i love margarita ,will someone let me know wat is triple sec tq!
Being completely out of my element, this recipe saved the day and was a great success! Thank you to all those who took the time to write reviews and tips...!
TASTY!!! Perfect! I used 1800 and it was smooth and perfect!!!
As written would be too strong for me but is very good. We did the recipe but added 12oz limeade instead of 6. Don't add too much ice or it will be too cold to drink without getting a brain freeze.
These were simply amazing. My hubby even drank some with me and he doesn't like margaritas very much
Most excellent! Most E-Z!

Such a simple recipe for great margaritas! I was skeptical, but they are definetly good! I did reduce the tequila to 5 oz. because I prefer not to fall down after two margaritas. I also used 4 cups of crushed ice. It was the perfect combination.
This recipe is awesome! It makes a lot, so when I have leftovers, I just stick it in the freezer. Later, I take it out and eat it with a spoon for dessert. This is a fun and easy recipe!
Oh my...what a find!! These are almost TOO good! Thanks so much for sharing the recipe. I didn't change a thing...didn't see the need to!
I add 1/2 c of powdered sugar (balances the strength of the alcohol) everyone loves them!
Absolutely Delicious!!! Thank you!
awesome- kinda strong but good

I attempted to make this on the rocks, because that is how I prefer my margaritas. Not bad! I doubled the contents of limeade, triple sec, and tequila. In place of ice, I used water (filled the limeade container twice). It turned out well, but seemed to be missing something so I added lemon juice (did not have lime on hand) for more of a sour taste, and then topped with Grand Marnier! Definitely worth it :)
I stumbled on this method of making Margarita's because I refused to by the mix with a mile long list on ingredients- Thank you for helping me refine it. Everyone loves them
ThAts a recipe that I use but u really need to add a 16oz coronna to all that and a pound of strawberries And ice I'm telling u. You will be amazed my old girl taught me this. Mine a 5. Hers 3
Finally!!! This is an excellent and easy recipe. Thank you!
We love this recipe - we make it at least 3-4 times per month. We make a double batch and take it to the pool in a pitcher and keep it in the cooler. Great drink, thanks for the recipe.
Used 1 (12 oz) can of Minutemaid Frozen Limeade with 6 oz Tequila and 3 oz Triples sec. These were the best!!!!
These are good but sweet. I add a 1/2 bottle of beer to the blender. It adds some fizz and cuts the sweetness as well. I know it sounds strange but I've gotten nothing but RAVE reviews!!!
Very good and quick and easy.
Very simple to make and our friends did like them. Usually have the tequila and triple sec on hand. Next time I will use some O.J. or splenda to see if there is a difference.

I have been making Margaritas very similar to this for some time now. I found myself with no good limes one hot day while I was making Tacos...GASP RIGHT!! ha I always have lime aid in the freezer so....walla...The best frozen Margarita was born. I use about a Tablespoon or less of sugar per-pitcher and prefer just a splash of or no triple sec. I use 4 oz Tequila, 1/3 can frozen lime aid, sugar to taste up to 1 tablespoon, splash of triple sec (or none), 2 cups of ice. Place all in that order in a blender. Puree until smooth...Everyone loves these. Now go get out on the deck on a nice hot day and ENJOY!

I was visiting my brother and made this for a gathering of our old friends we grew up with. Everyone loved it and begged for another pitcher, which went as quickly as the first. It was awesome and so easy!!

I make mine with 6 oz pineapple juice concentrate, 6 oz limeade concentrate, 1 cup tequila, 1 cup triple sec, ice and a blender. They are the best original margaritas around! The pineapple takes the twang out of the limeade. For strawberry margaritas use 8 oz frozen strawberries in juice, 4 oz frozen limeade concentrate, 6 oz tequila, 2 oz triple sec, ice and a blender is all you need.
we've been making them this way for a couple years and they taste FABULOUS! Much better than the margarita pre mix.
for a lighter calorie version use lemon/lime crystal lite :) I add fresh lemon and lime slices to the jug of mix

I've been making a version of this recipe for years, and everyone loves it. So much better than the bottled mixes! If you don't have triple sec on hand, fresh orange juice works well. Also, try it with a couple splashes of beer, and rim the glasses with fresh lime before dipping in salt. Yummy!
Delicious! I made these margaritas for a girls night in and my friends couldn't get enough of them! Next time I will have to buy more frozen limeade.

These were great. I will defiantly try mixing some other things in them and play with this recipe. The original recipe is fine all by itself. I would recommend it to anyone and will be making this again real soon.
EASY! ....and delicious! We rimmed our margarita glasses with salt. I had multiplied this recipe to 20 servings and am glad that I did. My glasses held 2 servings each. :)
I just tried this recipe and it ROCKS !!!!!

These are awesome!! I have been looking for a margarita recipe that didn't use those horrible bottled mixes. Finally found the perfect one! Made these this afternoon for an outdoor party and they were the hit of the day! Never, ever will we use the bottled mixes again. So good, and so easy!
WOW!!!! Great, easy margarita recipe! I've never been able to make good ones at home until now!!! Thanks for sharing!
really, really simple and wonderfully delicious!

My margaritas have always been awful, and that's sad, considering I'm from Texas. Never did like the cloying taste of bottled margarita mix. This recipe, however, is wonderful. Also, a bartender made some suggestions on what you could add to make it even better, which I did -- cointreau, OJ, a can of diet 7-up, and oddly? A bit of rum.
THE BEST!! So simple and easy to make while having a party,I have a margaritaville machine and it made a whole pitcher fast! The don't taste strong but they are strong so beware!
Excellent! I don't care for the taste of the pre-made mixes, but this tastes just like the margaritas served in restaurants!
Okay but not good. You can definitely tell it is made with limeade instead of fresh limes, it just tastes a little dingy.

LOVED THESE! So easy, even a drunk can do it ;) I took the bartender's advice and added a little orange juice, but that's the only change I made. I will never make another margarita. My husband matched me skeptically, but he loved them as well.
great recipe! love this! i also add strawberries when they're in season :)

For the longest time I wouldn't drink tequila until I had a margarita at a friends house. This recipe is great and I really enjoyed it. I know many reviews added OJ to cut the tart/flavor but my friend used 2 frozen strawberries to do the same thing, I did this with this recipe. It does change the color but it was fantastic.
This is a great recipe. I made it for a family get together and everybody thought it was the best. I will only use this from now on, NO MORE MIXES!! Thank you!

The basic concept is 5 star, and if you use good liquor you get a truly restaurant quality margarita. As stated, I thought the ratio of limeade to alcohol was a little off and ended up adding more tequila and ice. I got a "Margarator" as a gift last Christmas, and I highly recommend it. The texture is snowy and perfect.

We listened to the 'bartender' and added about 2 oz. (by mistake) of Orange Juice and these margaritas were to die for!! Seems like the OJ took the bitterness away from the limeade. Beat any restaurant margaritas in town by a long shot! Thanks for the tip.
I love making these for Cinco De Mayo Parties. I ad a little bit of powdered Sugar to the mix, and rim the glasses with the sugar too, so that they aren't so sour.

Usually I make "original" margaritas with freshly squeezed lime juice, but needed something quicker for a party. I was glad I picked this recipe! It was so easy and the margaritas are wonderful!!! I did not fill the blender with ice all the way to the top with the first batch (was afraid it would overflow), and the margaritas were too strong. The following batches were perfect. Recommend making before the guests arrive (especially if your blender is really loud), put in a plastic jug and put in the ice in your beverage tub. It keeps better than you would expect. Make sure you buy enough limeade! Would recommend to calculate 1 batch per every 4 guests, more if there are no other beverages (we used up 4 batches for 18 people, despite offering also wine, beer, and non-alcoholic drinks)

I like the limeade idea as I have used it for years, sans the triple sec. I take 1 small can of limeade, pour over blender full of ice, then fill that same can with tequila pour in the blender, then fill that same can with BEER. Comes out perfect!
These margaritas are delicious!!! I add a little bit of orange juice and squeeze fresh lime into them to make them even better.
Made these all last summer for sipping on our beach. So easy and delish!
super yummy....love the flavor
Very good margarita!
Too sweet. Lacks dimension. You could lick the limeade can and not taste the difference. One reviewer added OJ and I think I will try that next time.
Quite tasty! I like to rim my glass with sugar instead of salt.

this by and far is the best margarita I have ever had! And so easy who would have guessed? I was a bartender for several years and have made every kind imaginable, that everyone said was the best! But this recipe is the best!
This recipe turned me on to Margaritas. I never liked tequila before... This is the PERFECT drink recipe!

This recipe is a huge hit at parties! A great alternative to using those chemical-tasting margarita mixes! Sometimes this recipe is too sweet for my taste so I add some natural orange juice to thin out the margarita both in consistency and sweetness. Also, if you don't have Triple Sec on hand, Grand Marnier is a great substitute

This is very similar to my gpa's recipe that was a family Christmas tradition. He had a great way of measuring, 1 can limeade, 1/2 can tequila, 1/3 can triple sec. Add a splash of orange juice and half a lime, rind and all in the blender, and it brings back all those Christmas celebrations with him!
Awesome margaritas - just like the ones in the restaurants! Since I started making this recipe, I've had way to many happy hours to count! Everyone love it. Thanks!
sorry, way too sweet.

This recipe is about as easy as they come -- with my regular Kitchen Aid blender I don't even crush the ice first. These Margaritas are not too sweet, not too tart, and they will get rave reviews from your friends! What more could you ask for in a drink?!? This recipe is a keeper.
This is so easy to make and tastes oh so good!

I have been making this for a while now and everyone loves it. However recently we went to an Italian Rest.; and had an Italian Margarita and now have changed it a little. What I now do is use the can of limeade; then use 1/2 can water; 1/2 can - ok - maybe a little more of tequila; almost 1/2 a can of triple sec or a good Orange liquire; then I mix in a blender with no ice. Pour into a salt rimmed glass over ice; and then add 1 shot of Ameratto to the glass. WOW- it sure does knock it up a noch and is super good. Thanks so much for this recipe. - PS - you can use Kosher Salt instead of 'Margarita Salt' its easier to find and cheaper.

Awesome! I tried this on the rocks and added one cup of water to make up for it not being frozen. Also- added a "Ms. Thang" twist with three squeezed orange wedges and a short splash of orange juice. Wow!! it was sooo good. I cant wait to invite friends over to try.
perfect recipe! Just what i was looking for

I had a margarita and fajita themed birthday party for my son's 3rd birthday party. Tired of the same old pizza and cake routine, I decided to make fajitas and margaritas, so that all the grown-ups could enjoy themselves too! This margarita recipe was fantastic and a hit. I followed the recipe exactly and added some fresh lime juice and an ounce of OJ for those that wanted margaritas on the rocks. I also made several frozen batches with whole fresh mango chunks blended in, finished with a Chambord float on top, like one reviewer mentioned. It was amazing! The margaritas went well with the Avocado, Tomato and Mango Salsa on this site. Thanks for the great recipe.

Perfect! This is the first margarita recipe that I've tried, but I don't think I need to look any further! I enjoyed this slushy, slightly tart, and just-sweet-enough concoction with tortillas and salsa. It was better than the restaurant margaritas I've tried. It was tastier than a prepackaged mixer without any extra work. Omit the tequila and triple sec and add a splash of orange juice for an alcohol-free treat that can be enjoyed by everyone!
Excellent! No better way to make margaritas!
We added 1 oz of orange liquor too! Yummy
This is the best margarita I have ever made at home. Everybody loved them and I will never use a margarita mix again!
This recipe is FANTASTIC! My fiance and I decided to mix up a pitcher of margaritas and power lounge in the back yard. This margarita was the perfect thing for a warm summer evening.
too sweet, I would dilute the limeade first before adding the alcohol
Best margaritas ever and boy do they pack a punch!

For years now I've been buying the Jose Cuervo mix in the supermarket for almost $7.00 a bottle, and it doesn't come CLOSE to tasting as good as this very simple recipe! The secret is filling the blender with ice, and then the addition of the frozen limeade concentrate makes it the perfect consistency for a blended margarita. This tasted authentic, and exactly like the drinks I have ordered and enjoyed from Mexican restaurants. I am hooked on this recipe now! Great, delicious, easy to make, and much cheaper than a premade mix - I'll never make margaritas any other way again.
Easy and better than any I've ever had. Will definitely make again, in fact I'm making it again right now. Can't wait to drink it. Yummy yummy yummy.
Delicious! Easy and doesn't leave that too sweet tast in your mouth like some premade margarita mixes! This will be my regular margarita recipe!!
Tasty. But might I suggest using Sauza blanco or gold tequila. It's the #1 selling tequila in Mexico. (I think that says alot!!!) It's really a great tequila.
Yum! I didn't have any Triple Sec, so I substituted Grand Marnier and they were delicious!
These may not be the most authentic margaritas and a little sweet, but they are very, very good.

It has been hot this week in the beautiful Pacific Northwest and I decided to look up a margarita recipe to surprise my hubby and I came across this easy recipe. So I ran to the grocery store first to get ingredients for fish tacos and then off to get the stuff for the margaritas. It was difficult to find the salt for the rims! So while my husband was waiting for dinner I made him one of these margaritas and it sure put a smile on his face! It really cooled things off!
the description says it all simple and superb!
Simple and Superb!
So yummy and completely fool-proof! I took suggestions and added only 5 shots of tequila and also the juice of one lime. Also used Cointreau instead of triple sec and was great!

Excellent and easy! I used 1/2 Tequila and 1/2 Triple Sec and added the juice and pulp of one lime (reamed). Made these in my slushy maker and WOW! I need look no further. NOTE - do read the review by Cooper4 for some GREAT ideas how to change this up to a blue 'rita, or a fruit 'rita! My freezer is full of limeade and I'm ready to let summer 2009 begin! Thanks for the great recipe!
These margaritas are great, better than most restraunts! Make sure to use Corona for the beer.
This is my "go to" recipe whenever I am in the mood for a Margarita. It's fantastic!
Ok, I was really craving mexican food last night and I needed the whole thing. First time ever making margaritas, and these are fantastic.
I love this very easy recipe. We made in on vacation. We added just a little more tequilla for a kick.

I first tried this on New Year's eve at a party we went to. Everyone loved them! I have made them several times since. This has to be the best margarita I have ever made. I did add some orange juice to the mix like previously mentioned in another review. About the same about as you add triple sec. YUMMY!
Excellent! Love being able to make and drink a great Margarita at home. I added 2 fluid ounces of Orange Juice.
Good. I like this, its like going to good restaurant but having it at home!
These are perfect!
too sweet for my taste.
added one full mango in there too. awesome. this is a great recipe on its own or as a base.
wouldn't change a thing!
This is a very good base line for a Margarita, I tried it with Watermellon and WOW what a treat on a hot summer day. Just remember to remove the seeds after your had a couple :-}
Fabulous. The only change we made was to reduce the amount of alcohol to 75% of the original amount. Everyone just raved about these!
Delish classic margaritas. No syrupy pre-made mix here! We like them fairly strong, so this was perfect.
This recipe is great. I keep the ingredients handy for surprise guests or when I've had a hard day at the office. Very good and super easy.
These were good, but I still love my favorite when I'm drinking at home I like the "Master of Mixes" mix we buy in the grocery store! I know... but it's good!
These are GREAT. Didn't change a thing.

These Margaritas are truly a hit.....I have made them at several parties and they have recieved RAVE reviews from everyone. This recipe is WONDERFUL!! A lot of my friends use the bottled margarita mixers...once I let them in on this recipe..they are through with that stuff. I have branched out to start adding frozen fruit such as strawberries and peaches.....DELISH!! Thank you so much for this recipe...you have made me the Margarita Queen.
Too sweet!
Tasty and foolproof! I had never used limeade in a Margarita before, but I loved it. Will make again.
I've been using this recipe for years. I usually add 3 oz of triple sec. It makes it a little sweeter.

Great recipe! I took the suggestion of adding a half ounce of orange juice and fresh lime juice. Also used the suggestion of using the limeaide container for measuring -- a less than 3/4 full of tequilla and 1/4 of the container of triple sec. Perfect!
Like a few others said, they were a bit TOO strong. I don't like the tequila to overpower the drink, and this one did. Next time I'll use maybe 4oz. tequila, instead of 6. Love the limeade idea!

These margaritas are the BOMB and SO easy to make. I bought a margaritaville frozen concoction machine recently and wanted to take it down to my sister's for our annual 4th of July party at her house by the beach. I searched for a recipe and found this one. I am so glad I picked this one, because these were a huge hit at the party! I ended up being the bartender for the night and made batch after batch of these delicious drinks. Some people thought the limeade a bit too tangy so I used 1/2 the can of limeade and squeezed a tad of fresh lime in the mix. They were perfect!! This will be the drink now for our 4th of July party from now on!

I made this once using the exact recipe and it was great, but all the sugar from pre-made mixes sometimes gives me a headache... So, using the idea of limeade from this recipe, I decided to make fresh limeade to replace the frozen concentrate. I used the honey limeade recipe found here, to which I added about 2-3 tbs of fresh-squeezed orange juice. I first poured the liquor and then kinda eyeballed the amount of limeade, serving it on the rocks. It's a great alternative if you're feeling ambitious enough to go homemade once in a while.

Followed previous reviewer's advice and tweaked the recipe as follows. I used the suggested amount of triple sec, but also added 1 oz Grand Marnier. I also added 1 oz. Orange Juice and 3 oz. Beer. It really takes away the sour taste. I also squeezed a lime into the blender. Everyone at the party raved about these. They went so fast that we had to run to the store to buy more ingredients!
excellent!!! We had a friend that always made these, and they are my favorite way to make good margaritas at home. Love that the ingredients are cheap and easy to have on hand.
I love Margaritas - this recipe is a keeper! Had Margaritas at a Mexican restaurant last week - this one's much better.
For a twist , I use Blue Curacao instead of Triple Sec (make sure you use clear tequila) and they come out a lovely blue color!
These were really good! I added the juice of a fresh squeezed lime, which made them taste authentic. NEVER use the pre-bottled margarita mix...it just doesn't compare!!!

The perfect summer drink. I prefer Cointreau instead of Triple Sec, add a generous squeeze of fresh lime to the blender, and be sure to use crushed ice. If you have a blood orange on hand, squeeze a 1/2 into the blender as well. This makes the prettiest party drink ever.
As good as any I've had in a restaurant - and a whole lot more economical. Yummy!
Very good. Tossed half a lime into the blender along with the other ingredients and then strained the contents of the blender into margartia glasses. Yum!
This recipe was easy and absolutely delicious!!
My fiance and I adore this recipe! I make it just as posted, but at grand marnier to make it a cadillac margarita. It's my #1 at home margarita now, and I'll never use the store bought mix again!

I make mine the same way! Now that it is summer you HAVE to try this! Chunk up and de-seed about 2 to 3 cups of watermelon. Freeze the watermelon and add with the ice when making these margaritas. Freezing is key to keeping the drink a good thick frozen consistancy. Also, you can de-seed then puree and freeze in ice cube trays for later use. Just pop them in a zipper bag to keep fresh tasting. These will be the hit at your BBQ or next party!
THIS WAS REALLY GOOD.
YUMMY :-)

These are fabulous! I mix two cans of water with the limeade, a spoon of orange juice concentrate and two fresh squeezed limes. Then pour it all into my ice cream freezer. You have never tasted anything so good! It's like they came out of a margarita machine!
Even friends who say they don't like frozen margaritas cannot get enough of these.
Excellent
Anybody know how this recipe turns out if I dissolve all of the frozen limade and serve it on the rocks?? Plan on making a huge amount for a party!
The best margarita I've ever had at home. I make mine on the rocks instead of frozen though. And I added a little orange juice and some fresh lime juice as well. Delicious!
I added 2 oz Rose's lime juice - PERFECT!! I've been hunting for the right combination (I don't like the sour mix most places use) and this is it!! A houseful of Mexicans agree!

I tried this yesterday because it sounded so simple and got great reviews. Wow! It was a diffrent take that is for sure. I did the second batch with a bit less teq. and added some fesh lime juice and a little bit of sugar, 1 Tbs. It makes it so they are not as strong. Its flavor is a world of diffrence from the store bought mixer!

I have been making margaritas with a very similar recipe for 20 years so I was shocked when I saw this. However, I use a 12 oz can of limeade and mix in the tequila and triple sec on a 2:1 ratio. Depending on how strong your like your tequila I've made them with 1/2 C tequila, 1/4 C triple sec all the way up to a full cup of tequila.
Just like another reviewer, I added orange juice to make the perfect margarita.
I used Jose Cuervo Premium Gold and Cointreau and added the orange juice. Best Margarita ever!

I loved this recipe. I love good margaritas, and the mixes they sell just do not cut it. This did not have the awkward taste that some mixes do. Even my husband thought it was good, and he hates mixed drinks. I used Miller Lite Chill, with the lime flavoring in it. Do not know if it helped for sure or not, but it didn't hurt.

Five star Margarita made simple! Like a previous reviewer, I am an ex bartender and have always been in search of a better Margarita. Using the limeade is such a great alternative to the sour mix. I made mine on the rocks and it is oh so perfect! Thanks Katherine!
We make these at every get together and I CRAAAVE them in between. :) This is a wonderful margarita recipe, especially if you like em' a little tangy.
This recipe was very simple but I thought the margaritas were bland. Maybe I should have tried some additions as suggested by other reviewers.
I hate margaritas but these were really good. I had a party and everyone seemed to like them!
Make sure and check out COOPER4's review for additions!

This recipe is a must have!!! Instead of using the frozen limeade, I have made them with frozen mexican fruit juices located at the corner mexican market. Parcha/passion fruit is absolutely amazing! Everyone loves them! Also try using Jose Cuervo Citrico..it's a cheap tequila but with the passion fruit, you can't even taste a trace of it.

Perfectly simple, fast and delicious! Made these for Mexican night and Everyone Loved these margaritas, and they are a cinch to make when everyone asks for more! The only recipe I will use from now on! Thanks!
i have made my margaritas like this for years and will never change them!
It's ok. I don't think that concentrated limeade comes anywhere close to the taste of real lime juice.
really good just a little bit too strong, next time i will use less tequila
Very easy and very yummy!! I added a little bit of Grand Mariner WOW!!

I rated this years ago. It was the top rated review but it mysteriously dissappeared so I'll try again. Ever since I found this recipe my search for the perfect Margarita has ended! In my former life I spend many, many years bartending in a popular restaurant know for it's signature drinks. Despite that experience I struggled to duplicate a decent margarita at home. I didn't have the secret spice mix, none of the (expensive) mixes out there even came close, and messing with all of those limes and sugar was, well, a mess! Search no more folks, this is sooo easy and makes the perfect Margarita to boot. Ialways add a splash of O.J. to the blender. To make it "golden" sub Gran Marnier or Cointrau (sp?) or a combo of both for the Triple Sec. In the summer I often replace half of the ice with frozen chunks of watermelon and it is devine! If you prefer your margarita on the rocks, cut the recipe with 1/2 h20, put in a shaker with ice, shake shake shake and pour into your ice filled glass.

These things are GOOOOOOOd youll never regret making them, I followed the bartender's review and added a half oz of OJ to the original recipe. To top it off I swirled a half oz of Chambord on top! I couldnt find Limeade, so I used a Bacardi Mixer from the freezer isle
Will never go back to the "mixes" again! :)

Because this recipe was so simple, I was thinking these margaritas would probably be good, but not great. They were fantastic! Thanks to KDA949 for the great advice to measure the tequila and triple sec using the limeade container. These could not have been any easier to make and everyone at my party loved them!

Wow! These margaritas were delicious. I'm rather picky about my margaritas, but I really liked this one and so did everyone else. We ended up making 2 batches. Rimmed the glasses with kosher salt - great summer drink.
This really is the best recipe for marqaritas. Part of the beauty of it is that it's so simple.
Excellent flavor with minimum work!!! Great recipe. Thanks!
this is my dads recipe as well, and yet, the best, bar none!
This is the classic recipe we have used for years, and it is perfect every single time!
I have been using this receipe since the early nineties..the only thing I do differently is add a half can of club soda which seems to cut a tad of the tart taste..try frozen mango chunks..yummy
Delicious! These were really easy to make and tasted great!

This is a recipe I have used forever. I was glad to see someone else uses it as well. It is always a hit at parties! For over the rocks just add a bit of water instead of ice (it ends up tasting a bit stonger).
Excellent. Everyone liked them.
Followed the reviewer who said 3/4 can of tequila and 1/4 triple sec, but also added a splash of grand marnie. OH boy after two I was feeling so fine!
I have been making these since 1984! They have been a huge hit every time I have served them. I like to keep them in the freezer for stress free entertaining!
Out of tequila, so we made with Gold Rum (not spiced), and we liked even better than a traditional margarita. These are very good, and as easy as prepared mixes that taste like fake juice.
The limeade is a great alternative if you don't have fresh lime juice. I will probably be making these all summer.
My husband has been making these same margaritas for years. We love them and so do all of our friends and family.

I've never cared for margaritas. The few I've tried just tasted kind of nasty, so I had no interest in making them at home. Then, Cinco de Mayo 2007 came along... :) And, Katherine, you've changed my view on this fabulous drink! I made one batch with limeade (I cut the 12-oz can in half lengthwise and stuck the second half in a freezer bag, back in the freezer!) and used 1½ or 2 trays of ice cubes... Well, they were a little strong! The second batch somehow turned out stronger... Nice to drink while watching our daughter playing in her wading pool in 90-degree weather in early May! I also made a batch with pink lemonade instead of limeade and it turned out wonderful as well. Seriously, thanks so much for sharing this recipe, Katherine!
My absolute favorite drink. I make it as written, or sometimes squeeze in the juice of an orange. Yum.
SOOOO good! I add frozen strawberries. I served these twice at my house and five of the 15 got pregnant. Coincidence?
These are fantastic! After trying several other recipes, I found this one and then my husband declared that I had found my calling as a drink mixer. :) Enjoy!
great as is! if you want to lighten the tart, and add some color, throw in a few frozen strawberries.

There was just something funny tasting about these, the limeade flavor was really strong and not at all like what margaritas taste like to me. I made this two nights and just couldn't get the flavor right, even following the directions exactly. Maybe I will try it again using Contrieu instead of Triple Sec, and maybe using a frozen sour mix instead of limeade. I definitely won't make it again as written.
Fabulous and easy! We followed the directions exactly for our Cinco de Mayo - doubled the recipe and enjoyed every last drop!
Fabulous & Strong...Just The Way I Like It!!! The Only Change I Made Was An Addition Of Raspberry & Peaches To Make It Fruit....& It Went Great With The Limeade!!!
yummy... try them with Contreau instead of triple sec.
My husband has used this recipe from south Texas for years. He calls it "Border Buttermilk." Everyone loves it and we've given the recipe to many people.
Super easy, and really delicious.
sweet
I finally killed my blender making these. They are the best.

Made these for my fiance after a rough night at work, he loved them! Said we'll definitely have to make these this summer when we're hanging around the pool. I prefer mine fruity, so next time, I'll take his half out, and add some frozen strawberries to my half. Thanks for the great margarita recipe!
LoVed this recipe for Margaritas!!!!!!!!!!!! It is sooo easy to make and is better than purchasing and squeeIng all those limes! Great recipe..will only use this one from now on!!

Excellent margaritas!!! Great blend of all the flavors and I added a few frozen mixed berries for added color and flavor. My guests loved them and I plan on using this recipe for a long time. Thanks!!

Well, my husband, who fancies himself a "Margarita Master" and has been loyal to his father's famous recipe forever, really liked these MUCH easier frozen margaritas! So did I! The limeade does NOT make them overly sweet or "kiddy"-like. They are just sweet enough. Oh, try using Cointreau in lieu of the Triple Sec for a real "Cadillac" of a margarita. GREAT--either way. Thanks for the recipe!
I've been making these for years! I've made the following changes....I always add an ounce of cointreau and an once of chambourg.....I also agree with the guy who adds beer...delicioso!!

Absolutely perfect! I have been trying to find a comparable recipe for frozen margaritas I found everywhere on the Las Vegas Strip - particularly "Fat Tuesday's" - these are doing the trick! I'm making them in the middle of winter in Toronto - I can't wait to have them in the summer around the pool!
Very tastey! I am a margarita lover and this is awesome. thanks!
I made these margaritas for a family get together and they were a huge success and so easy and quick to make.

We make these quite often, they are wonderful! I like to up the triple sec to 3 and the tequila to 4 or 5, a little less kick to it for me. Adding frozen strawberries makes a tasty strawberry margartia.
These are so good, you would be surprised they're so easy to make. Tastier and easier than a margarita mix. Enjoy!
This is the 2nd time I've made these now and they are awesome! Be sure to use minute maid limeade and for more tartness and color, add a little red wine or sangria on top!

YUMMY I have been making these drinks for years and have always gotten loads of compliments. Everyone says they are the best margaritas they have ever had and I have been asked for the recipe many times. For strawberry margaritas add either fresh or frozen strawberries. Mango margaritas can be made by adding a ripe peeled and pitted mango. Your friends will tell you they are better than any bar margarita. They are super easy, less expensive, and soooo much better.

This is the recipe I use for my Margaritas, THE ONLY DIFFERENCE IS: I add 1 can/bottle of beer at the very end. Becareful when blending in the beer, use quick little zaps because you do not want this to foam up. When I tell friends what my "secrete ingredient" is, there amazed because they can't taste the beer, but it does add a nice flair to the drinks!
i used skyy instead it was a hit at my party
Yummm... These were great. But the Beer Margaritas are still my fav.
Awesome! Best margaritas ever!!

STRONG!! All the guys at my party were laughing at how strong these were. I began adding more of the frozen limeaid and they were much better. I also added some frozen stawberries to some and those were a BIG hit! I will definately make these again!
The ABSOLUTE best margarita by far! Thank you for sharing! I used Patron & added fresh strawberries to the second batch. This is the one & only recipe you'll ever need!!
Very good!!! I have used this recipe several times with good results.
These are excellent margaritas! I make them on the rocks or blended and both are fabulous!
very good will make again for sure
This recipe is so good.......it's sweet, sour and just the right consistency of alcohol..I will definietely be making this again and again....
Perfect margarita recipe, Don't change a thing! This was better than any restaurant margarita I've ever had.
