The best Sangria recipe I have used!! It really does help to refrigerate the sangria the night before. Also, adding gingerale instead of club soda intensifies the flavor! Great recipe to have!!
Made this for bbq party we had for my husband's birthday made a double batch.. with everything but the cherries everyone loved it best sangria recipe yet thanks
I've tried many sangria recipes and this is the best - and most potent. Before we knew it all us ladies were giggling up a storm! Make a day ahead and it's even better!
Loved it! Will be my go to sangria recipe. Quadrupled the recipe - it all went.
Wonderful! Was extremely popular at our open house. We used: burgundy wine, triple sec, fresca.

i made 5 gallons of this today for my bbq. i used a fifth of brandy and 2 gallon jugs of wine. i didnt use the triple sec i forgot it so i upped the orange juice because triple sec tastes like oranges. i used 7up since i already had it for the party. this was beautiful and all that was left was a 2 qt pitcher and everyone was very smiley.
Delicious and very pretty! I used gingerale and thought the taste was perfect for a BBQ on a hot summer day.

I served this sangria at my wedding last month and it was a HUGE hit! Everyone loved it. I omitted the sugar and cherries, and used ginger ale instead of club soda. We made it the night before and let it sit overnight (a full 24 hours) before adding the ginger ale, it was absolutely perfect! We made 15 batches of both this red and another white sangria, and this one was gone before the end of the night! I will definitely be making it again.

Never made sangria before. AWESOME recipe! Didn't have triple sec (so just substituted in more brandy) and didn't have lemonade concentrate (so just added in more lemon juice). Read the recipes that said it should really rest 24 hours and so I was a little concerned because I made it in the morning for an evening dinner party. Even with all those changes and letting it rest abour 8 hours, it turned out delicious! The whole pitcher was gone. Didn't add the carbonated water or the cherries- didn't care for them and the sangria still tasted great. Thanks for the recipe!

This was excellent! I added sierra mist at the end, and not the water. I also added random fruits that I had in the house, so not everything in the list. It was great. Everyone enjoyed it and it was so easy to make!
This was a fantastic recipe! I subed the brandy for rum, triple sec for peach schnapps, used only 2/3 the sugar, and no carbonated water. Sweet enough, and potent!

This recipe is great. I modified it slightly by adding chopped asian pears and substituting Canada Dry Ginger Ale for the carbonated water. It was such a huge hit at the last party that we ran out so this time we're doubling up!
I made this one night for the pickiest of picky people and I was told it was "The Bomb". I had to make another batch while everyone was still here! Made exactly as written.
Made this for my birthday and all my guests were super happy with this drink. I made three times the amount!!! Yay!! Thanks for the recipe.

This is a favorite for summer BBQs and people always ask me to bring it. I don't have a specific wine I use - though I prefer a dry red and use less sugar, testing to taste. I use the citrus fruit as recommended by the recipe, but it would probably be great with green apples instead, as suggested by another reviewer. Because I like to keep it "dry" rather than sweet, I add carbonation with lemon-lime flavored seltzer water instead of 7up. This one is definitely a keeper!
Absolutely delish! I used Chianti for the red wine. Skipped the sugar, cherries and carbonated water. Everyone loved it!

This is GREAT! I only had about 6 hrs for this to sit in the fridge and it was really good. I did not use cherries. When I served it I filled the glass with plenty of ice, put fresh lemon and lime slices in each glass added a few raspberries, blueberries and blackberries and topped it off with a splash of soda water. It looked as good as it tasted!

Awesome recipe! I made a white version using a moscato. This is a sweet wine so be careful, you may not need the added sugar and use club soda. I chopped the apples in cubes and soaked in the brandy overnight prior to making the sangria. What an added surprise for those who bit into them. I received many many compliments.

This really IS the best Sangria I've ever had. I've made it 3 times in the last 3 weekends for friends and everyone (even white wine drinkers) really enjoyed it!! 1st time I made it pretty much to recipe - the 2nd time I didn't have any orange juice so fresh squeezed some and it was delicious. Never had the cherries - but it was great. And twice I didn't have the time for it to sit more than about 5 hours and it was still delicious.
Best Sangria recipe ever!! I have had authentic Sangria in Spain, and this is just like it, but it has a little something more and I love it! You can't go wrong with this recipe.
very tasty!thanks a bunch! I used sliced oranges as well.I used a cab and it worked well

Very tasty! So, I hate when people talk about how they changed everything in a recipe because then it's not really the recipe! I didn't have everything the recipe called for, so I did my best to replace with simliar items. I didn't have regular brandy, so I used cherry brandy. I didn't have triple sec, so I used Grand Mariner. I didn't have maraschino cherries, but I did have some sour cherries from Trader Joe's that I added. I let it sit about 30 hours. YUM! It was a hit! Thanks for the recipe!
Loved it. Also omitted cherries and sugar and used diet sprite, added apples, which were very yummy!
This was a big hit. I made it exactly from the direction but added ginger ale instead of club soda. It was gone fast and I have already had two requests for the recipe.

Ohhh Yeahh, THIS is the ONE! Incredible! Bartended for over 20 years, yet THIS recipe just blew me away. Make it, LOVE it! No sugar used and also chilled all ingredients, added only some of the citrus fruit to sit then removed it and added more fruit just prior to serving. Added frozen grapes, as well as frozen berries just prior to party to keep cool, per another reviewer (GREAT IDEA, btw!) Also diced fresh peaches, apple, whatever ya got prior to serving. Ah-MAZ-ING! Thanks for this oh so yummy recipe!

Love this recipe. I also tweaked it a bit for a lighter sangria as an alternative. I use White Zin instead of Red wine, use apple, canned pinapple (with juice), and mango for the fruit. I use no sugar, and use ginger ale instead of soda water. It is great either way. Dark or light.

AMAZING!!! This recipe is a definite keeper! Was missing some ingredients so had to tweak it a little but it turned out delicious. I omitted the Brandy and instead of using the lemonade concentrate I added extra fresh squeezed lemon juice and a little extra orange juice. Yummy. Thanks for sharing this fabulous recipe!
I live in Spain and the one thing missing from this is a bit of cinnamon. add a few sticks in the pitcher.

Fantastic - very similar to the Sangria we had in Barcelona! Modifications I made: used blackberry brandy and omitted the lemon juice - thought that would make it too tart, saved the club soda and added it by the glass instead of mixing it in. This is my new favorite drink!
This was the BEST Sangria ever... highly recommended!

Made this for my future sister in laws bridal shower. At first seemed a little strong, but the longer it sits the better it is. I let the fruit soak for about 24 hrs, then took the fruit out that morning of the shower. At the shower I added fresh oranges, cherries, strawberries and ginger ale. I also skipped the sugar and instead of carbonated water I used ginger ale. IT WAS EXCELLENT! I was asked to make this for the bachelorette party.
I was skeptical about some of the ingredients (frozen lemonade!) but this was great!!
This was better than the so-called 4* restaurant we went to. Didn't add the cherries or carbonated water and it didn't need it! Wonderful!
it's become a tradition with our friends. I can't have them over without making it or they think something is wrong. Very good! I just use boxed wine and it's very good.

Super yummy. Made a huge batch so I multiplied by 3. I didn't use the lemon juice or the sugar. I let the fruit marinate in the mixture over night but removed all the citrus rinds the next morning. I then added fresh citrus fruit a few hours before serving. The drink received rave reviews. The next day I removed the citrus rinds and added blackberries, strawberries, apples, and a few peaches (just what I had in kitchen) I served it with a few pieces of fruit in the glass, some ice, and a splash of ginger ale. (Subbed Sierra Mist when we ran out of ginger ale) We ended up finishing it off that second night. Not bad for 6 mommies!
I made a double batch for my book club, 4 girls. It was gone very quickly! I made it exactly as the recipe states, just left out the sugar. Yummy!

SO DELISH!!! I followed the recipe ALMOST exactly (will get to that in a bit). I doubled this recipe and it was SUCH A HIT at my 'Fiesta' themed party! Now, for the adjustments/additions I made. In reading other reviews, I adjusted as follows: I used an entire frozen lemonade container (tube). I did not add any fruits (no sliced lemon, no sliced lime, etc) until it had been marinating in the fridge for about 12 hours. Then 4 hours before serving, I added diced apple (1 red, 1 green), diced strawberries, diced lemon, diced lime, and blackberries. Instead of carbonated water, as I poured each drink I topped it off with a little Ginger Ale (in some cases I used Fresca, which was my personal favorite) and put a few extra blackberries and diced apples as a garnish. It was light, refreshing, and DELICIOUS!! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this recipe!!! :)

I made a double batch of this recipe and it was gone in a half an hour. They LOVED it! I added a few strawberries and omitted the sugar and it was amazing. Just made a double batch for dinner (it is WAY better when it sits for at least 24 hours)
This is a great recipe ... but I would not recommend putting the fruit in over night as I found that the fruit soaked up a lot of the sangria!

I used Ginger Ale instead of triple sec and Arbor Mist Pomegranate Berry Pinot Noir for the wine...everyone loved it! I also didn't bother with the maraschino cherries or the carbonated water. This was a great recipe =D
Just to add a little kick I added another 1/2 cup of brandy and instead of sparkling water add 1 bottle of champagne. That mixture will make everyone forget it's summer. Try it, you'll like it.

u can also use champagne, here in spain is fantastic and expensiver than the red wine sangria. but of course the color change a bit, and add some peach in cubes is wonderful eat them with all this flavour

I skipped the cherries, used a whole can of frozen lemonaide and substituted gingerale for the club soda. I did not add sugar - I added other sweet things :) Most Excellent!! I will freeze any leftovers, if any...., and make slushes :)

I skipped the cherries, used a whole can of frozen lemonaide and substituted gingerale for the club soda. I did not add sugar - I added other sweet things :) Most Excellent!! I will freeze any leftovers, if any...., and make slushes :)
no sugar and used ginger ale

Absolutely delicious Sangria. I loved it all throughout. One small change I had to make was to deduct the triple sec (didn't have any), and adding Ginger Ale. I had a BBQ for Canada Day, and this Sangria flew like nothing else. I had to prepare a second batch. A total keeper, thank you!
This was awesome!
Made this for a graduation party and tripled the recipe. There were no leftovers and lots of smiles. Delicious Sangria, thanks :)
Excellent! We used diet ginger ale in place of the water/sugar and added apple slices and peach schnapps (per NANAWAG's suggestion). Everyone loved it!

How refreshing! I omitted the lemon juice and triple sec and subsituted peach schnapps. I did quadruple the recipe and used only 1/2 cup sugar and a whole container of frozen lemon concentrate. I used more brandy and peach schnapps than listed. I will make again.

Delicious...I doubled the recipe and served it at a summer party, and it was a huge hit. Other than doubling it, I didn't change the recipe, other than leaving out the cherries. It is strong, but you won't realize how strong at first. It is so good, you may be tempted to drink it too quickly. Very, very good.
Really great recipe. My wine obsessed daughters really enjoyed it
I used 7up instead of sugar and carbonated water.
Sangria! Sangria! is the Best of the Best!!!

Excellent drink! We made a double batch and it was so delicious! We added more fruit than called for, adding pineapple, grapes and orange slices. We also used ginger ale instead of the carbonated water and only used 1/4 cup of sugar for the whole batch!

I tripled this recipe for a big bbq party. I used half blackberry brandy and 1/2 regular brandy. I used a red zin and had to end up adding some sugar to the recipe. Next time I won't add the extra lemon juice or lemon slices. I think it might have helped to make it a little too sour. I wasn't sure if I should let this sit out all night without being in the refrigerator but my container was too big to sit in the fridge so I took the advice of another review and stuck it in a ice chest with some ice overnight. Next time I might try apricot brandy because I like my sangria a little more fruity tasting and I don't think blackberry brandy is that much different than regular brandy. I forgot to add the sparkling water. I agree with other post. It doesn't need it.
Excellent flavor, easy recipe. We used Carlo Rossi Burgundy and Cointreau instead of Triple Sec. Delicious.

Made exactly as directed. Used a Spanish Cabernet and because it was pretty dry, I added the optional sugar. Made about 16 hours in advance and it was perfect by the pool the next day. I don't usually drink sangria but my friend is a fan and she said this was the best she has ever had. And I enjoyed it too.
The sangria was a hit at our barbecue. I didn't have any brandy, but used rum.

We liked this sangria as is, but LOVED it with the tweaks we made the second time we made it. We used orange mango juice, and that gave it a great flavor. We used blackberry flavored brandy and cut the amount in half since the original recipe was too strong for us. We substituted limeade and lime juice for the lemon juice and lemonade and thought it was so much better this way. We used cheap Spanish Rioja wine and did not use the sugar. Definite thumbs up from us, and we'll be making this all summer long!
Good!
can't wait to try this!
I had my girlfriends over and EVERYONE requested the recipe! I used a lemon/lime soda instead of carbonated water! Delicious!!!!

just served this last night at my husband's 40th birthday last night and everyone loved it! tripled the recipe, added apple instead of lime, and cubed it...would chop the orange and lemon next time so its easier to eat. substituted limoncello for the triple sec, and a mixture of southern comfort and slivovitz (plum brandy) for the brandy. served it in 1 gallon mason jars with ladles which looked beautiful!

I received rave reviews when I brought this to a sangria party recently. The only modification I did was used Sprite and I did add about a cup of sugar...I just prefer wine more sweet. Highly recommend this recipe, as everyone who tasted it thought I bought it somewhere instead of making it:).
A great sangria! We followed the recipe, but omitted the sugar and used ginger ale instead of club soda and it was a hit!

LOVE!! I halved the sugar, used diet ginger ale instead of club soda, & added strawberries then let it all soak together overnight. It was amazing! Next time I will omit the strawberries or add them right before serving because they didn't hold up well over time.
This was fantastic left out the optional items and added fresh apples, strawberries and grapes. Will be making this all summer.

LOVE LOVE LOVE! I use the Gallo pinot noir (the 1.5L) and double all the ingredients except for the sugar, which I only use 1/4 cup. I omit the cherries and the carbonated water and its heavenly. Let is sit overnight.... VERY important. I have made it for the last three get togethers and with all that Sangria its gone by two hours in. If I had a bigger pitcher I would make even more! Delicious :)

I've never made sangria before but, as other reviewers noted, this is an excellent recipe! It is strong but you won't notice by the flavor. I used a $10 (on sale for $7) shiraz. I would't recommend using the least expensive wine becuase there is a lot of wine flavor through the fruit.

I have made this sangria for several bbqs now and it is always hit. I usually bulk up the recipe by adding some carlo rossi sangria after i already multiply the recipe by 5. Usually add some strawberries too!

As collectors of fine wines we generally sneer at wine "cocktails" or anything that alters the wine. But I wanted to try something a little different, and convinced my wine snob husband to do the same. I made this exactly as directed, the only difference being that I didn't see the need to add soda to the drink. I can see that if one is not accustomed, adding a little soda could make it go down easier. I made it a day ahead, and we had it as a weekend cocktail--very tasty! I reminded my husband that I would order something similar at a bar, served in a tall glass with crushed ice, a straw, & garnished with a cherry or to, and happily pay 8 bucks. In fact, I think that's how I'll serve it in the future. Great summertime cocktail!
This is the best sangria I have ever had. Make it ahead of time so all the flavors can blend. Addicting.
I've made this several times and shared the recipe with others. Everyone LOVES it as do I!
This is a great recipe. I used Merlot because that is the bottle of red wine I don't like and ginger ale. Loved it and my guests did too!
Absolutely the best Sangria I've had. However, be forewarned.. this stuff is potent. One glass will have you tipsy!
I usually skip the sugar and use diet sprite or 7up.

KILLER!!! Left out the sugar and used gingerale. OMG after one glass I was feeling fine. Great flavour....the brandy gives it a great kick. Making this for a party on Saturday and I do not anticipate any leftovers! Thanks for sharing! :)

I made this for girls night out and it was a hit. I doubled the recipe. A few people thought it was REALLY potent and decided to switch to my Tropical Martini's. Those who were REAL drinkers enjoyed the robust taste. Thanks for the recipe!
Delicious! I added chopped apples and lime juice instead of a lime. I also used less brandy than it called for. I did not add sugar. I doesn't need any sugar! So good!!!
This was easy,fast and wonderful!! Thanks for the recipe - it worked great with Easter dinner and spring time on the way I will be making it more & more!!
I was a little skeptical that this recipe could really be that good, but it is! Very easy and so tasty. You don't need to try anything else.

Pretty good but still wish it were stronger. :) I used: 1.) 2 buck chuck - merlot 2.) Peach Shnapps instead of triple sec 3.) Cut the sugar out completely 4.) Added pears, apples, strawberries 5.) Had some 7-up on hand for guests 6.) Let the juice and fruit sit overnight Next time I'll add more brandy and peach schnapps. yum!
strong but yummy, will use some apples nxt time also
You've got to double or even triple this recipe if having a party. I spent all weekend making Sangria. It was THAT good! Also, I left out the sugar completely.

There's only one problem with this, if you follow the recipe exactly it goes very quickly. Don't bother making it unless you double it! I add the sugar and just add the club soda when I pour it into a glass.
Everybody loved this! I am going to make it again this weekend.

The best sangria I have ever drank! I was sad when it was all gone. I mixed it with the ginger ale and it made it nice and smooth going down. I used fresh squeezed orange and lemon juice and also added a little bit of lime juice.

BEST SANGRIA EVER!!! LOVE IT! I do make alittle change, I use a can of sliced pineapple and use the juice with/in place of the orange juice. I also throw in a ton of fruit. Strawberries, pomegranite, pineapple plus the oranges, lemon, and lime. And I used the advice of others and top it off with a splash of Gingerale. Thank you for such a great recipe.

I consider myself a Sangria "Critic" and I can say this recipe is wonderful-perhaps the best I've ever had (move over Olive Garden)! I cut back the lemons and limes by half and removed them after a few hours vs overnight (otherwise it gets very sour tasting). I have used limeaid (instead of lemonaid-can use either), always use gingerale (vs sugar and tonic water) and **blackberry brandy** (my favorite ingredient so I add about 1/2 C more). This is fabulous anytime of yr and great "on the rocks". My family & friends beg me to make for ALL gatherings now....so I always double the recipe. You will love this recipe even if you don't modify anything...enjoy!!
Da bomb!! Didn't leave anything out. This stuff is strong - the club soda helps and I like it better a little fizzy. Have made this 3 times - always a hit.
I made it with club soda and no sugar and a cheap bottle of dry wine. Still a hit at the party. Everyone loved it!

I make this regularly for parties and it never lasts!!! I usually only use about half of the sugar though, sometimes less, depending on my wine. All in all, this is an absolutely delicious recipe, and an oh so beautiful color! Don't forget to eat the fruit out of it the next morning. Mm mm good! Sangria is traditionally a recipe from Spain (yumm...) and, this recipe is pretty accurate. The only real difference between this and a legitimate Spanish sangria is the sweetness, which probably comes from the addition of the lemonade concentrate (and also the sugar, which I've already mentioned, but nobody said it was illegal to like your booze sweetened!)

I made this last weekend for a birthday bbq. I made mine in an iced tea jug the night before adding everything but the optional carbonated portion. Then I took 6 ice cube trays and dispensed half of the mixture into the trays. The following morning, I popped the frozen cubes back into the tea jug, added a can of sprite and gave it a stir! It was very yummy but I do have one complaint. While I was inside getting all the food ready to serve, it disappeared! I only got to have one glass :( Will be making often this summer! Thank you

The best sangria ever! The only I've ever had that compares was in Madrid at Zaharas. I did away with the club soda and used whatever fruit was handy (mostly apples, pears, and oranges). If you can let this sit overnight you'll be in for an even tastier treat the next day. I scoop out the old fruit and dice up fresh for the wine glasses.
Fair. It was expensive and took a long time to make, for a fair result.

This is really good and definitely best done a day ahead. I skip the sugar and use ginger ale or sprite instead of carbonated water (less chance of the sugar just falling to the bottom). I also skip the maraschino cherries as I don't care for them and they aren't very authentic. Cheap wine is fine here (in fact it's encouraged!). I often use the jugs of burgundy that you can get for around $10.

I tried this out Friday night for a game night at a friends house. They like wine but have never had Sangria before, my friends loved this. I will definitely be making this in the future especially considering a glass at a bar is about $12 here and most of these ingredients I keep on hand anyway!!
Yum. These are great! The only thing better would be fresh squeezed but this makes so quick and also goes so quick!
I made enough for 75! Omitted the sugar and used 7up... it was so DELICIOUS! Every drop.....gone....was a huge hit!
Careful on the frozen lemonade - measure 1/3 cup separately.
very tasty. one batch is enough.

This is a definite 5 star recipe!!! However, my husband and I made a few changes/substitutions. We used Pinot Noir instead of dry red wine, Appleton Rum VX instead of brandy, pink frozen lemonade concentrate instead of regular and ginger ale instead of the carbonated water. Oh and Grand Marnier (triple sec). Like some of the other reviews….it is very…very important to let rest a minimum of a day. The only issue we had was that we could only make one pitcher. Therefore we are on our way to replenish our ingredients and buy a bigger container.

I've made several sangria recipes and this is my favorite. I made it for a party and it was a hit. I also continued to have it for the next two days (I made a bit too much), and it still tasted good. I love this recipe. I don't use brandy because I don't like the taste of brandy. Sometimes I throw in the ingredients without measuring, and it tastes good regardless because all of the ingredients work well. I usually leave the cherries out too. I just thought it was a lot of fruit and they weren't necessary for me. Instead of carbonated water, I add ginger ale sometimes. Be sure to add it at the last minute though if you want bubbles.
This recipe is fantastic! We tripled this for a party of about 12 people and had to make another batch when it ran out. DEFINITELY use the sugar, but we didn't change a thing and it was perfect.
Served this at a recent dinner party, and it was a huge hit, everyone asked for the recipe!
I've made this several times and always use the cheapest dry red wine I can find. It always turns our great!
I made this for mom's night out and had to make another pitcher everyone loved it so much. It is definitely tastier if you let it soak overnight.
I made mine without Brandy simply because I did not have any handy. It was still delicious!
made a huge amount for our new years eve bash. Very popular drink, but wish I would have picked a different wine.
Excellent Sangria! We've tried several Sangrias around town to great disappointment, but this recipe was a huge success. Saving it in my Recipe Box for another batch soon :-).
This is the best! What a hit at our Christmas party! It was exactly like what we had in New York in Little Italy. Be prepared to have ingredients for a second batch on hand!

This is a great recipe, but a little on the sweet side, even without the sugar. I put in only 1/6 of a cup of lemonade concentrate and eliminated he maraschino cherries as well as the sugar. I found the fruit slices overwhelmed my pitcher, but I like them in the glasses. I fished the majority of the fruit of the pitcher before serving. I then sliced fresh lemon and orange slices and placed them in each glass and placed one on the rim of each glass as a beautiful garnish. Sadly, they made it very difficult to drink and all fruit ended up in the glass. With these changes I was asked to make this cocktail for every family function. Only after a double batch can put up with my in-laws. : )
I would remove rinds on fruit because it will leave a bitter taste. I minus the sugar and lemon and used grenadine instead of the sugar.... Delish!!!

Very Yummy! This was a big hit at our New Year's party. We ran out and had to piece together another batch (I'm sure it wasn't as good, but at that point no one seemed to notice). As other reviewers suggested, I left out the sugar and cherries and added 7 UP at the last minute. I also added an apple and pear and let it sit overnight in the fridge so the flavors all mingled together.
very tasty and good - it really packs a punch! Tell your guests to sip slowly and savor.
yum

I just made this for New Years and it was great. I added mixed berries. also instead of carbonated water.I had different flavored sparkling waters(key lime, lemon, etc )so everyone could customize their own glass. It was a big hit!!!
Have been going to spain or the past 15 years and this tastes as good as the sangria in spain. Great recipe thanks!

Made a double batch of this on Christmas Eve (2010). I should have made more because it was gone very quickly! Made just a few small changes: used rum instead of brandy because that's what we had on hand, left out the sugar, and added diet lemon lime soda instead of the carbonated water right before serving. It did need to be a little sweeter in my opinion, so I added a couple tablespoons of splenda. Might just have to make this again for New Year's!

If I could give this 10 stars I would! This makes the best sangria ever. I made this almost exactly true to the recipe the first time, and then made a few changes the next time to suit our tastes. I used limeade instead of lemonade as we found it a bit too lemony the first time. I added club soda instead of carbonated water right before serving and did not add sugar or cherries as it was plenty sweet enough. Another change I made was to add frozen grapes before serving to keep it cool and added 2 more oranges for more fruit to munch on. This is so good and refreshing on a hot summer day you will want to keeping drinking it but it hits you harder than you realize. We were already feeling it after the first glass, so be warned! :) Thank you so much for this recipe!
FANTASTIC!
big *h*i*t* with the familia! have to make a lot more next time.

I've used this recipe several times over the past few years, but I realized this last time I've never rated it! It's so good I never have enough! For our wedding reception/housewarming, I made 4 batches and filled our pretty glass bev dispenser... it was gone in an hour flat!! Make WAYYY more than you think you'll need, I'm planning on 8 batches for our next party.
Very good. Left out the cherries.
This was a hit at party I made this for yesterday. I left it the fridge overnight. I didn't use sugar or club soda. I left it up to the guests if they wanted ice in their drink.
This is good recipe. Made it for the first time and it was very good. My sweety liked it too.

It is no wonder why this has 5 stars it is amazing! If you have a big enough punch bowl, I recommend tripling the batch for larger groups. A single batch would be good for a group of 4 anymore and you want to double or triple it. I tripled it for a party of 15 and it was gone in about 2 hours. So if your party-goers enjoy sangria make a lot. The key is letting it sit over night in the fridge. Also one other tip to save on wine is Traders Joes – 2 Buck Chuck works great- I have used the Merlot, Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon and the Shriaz and got great result. (I do not recommend Chianti that other Sangria recipies call for, I think it always comes out too sweet.) I never have any leftovers of this when I have a party. I never use the sugar I think it would be too sweet and I always have two litters of club soda for people to add to it if they like, but I don’t mix it in the bowl. Also if you can take some of the lemon aid, maybe a little bit of water, some OJ and fruit and make an ice ring the night before to float in it so you don’t have to dilute it was ice.
Very good. I used ginger ale and no sugar, like others suggested.

delicious, but quite strong, so watch out... it'll sneak up on you! i like adding extra oranges because i enjoy eating the fruit - they absorb alcohol and become quite potent in themselves, yet still taste great!
Never really liked Sangria before this recipe. It is wonderful! Thanks to Hjacoby!!
Love it, Love it, Love it. My dad used to make this during the holidays and I have missed it since he has been gone!!! Thank you for bringing back such good memories for me and my family!!!

Awesome and easy to make! I absolutely HATE red wine and had some left over from a party I hosted. BUT this recipe made it delicious! I used sugar and gingerale to counteract the dry bitterness of red wine. Def recommend this!

great recipe! no need to use expensive wine-- i used $3 wine from trader joe's. if you are a lightweight like me, you don't need to put in the brandy nor triple sec. tasted fine without it. experiment by putting in different fruit juices, such as cranberry, apple, grape, etc. sprite, or carbonated fruit sodas are a great addition, too (don't use diet). i skipped the cherries & didn't miss them. i recommend making a block of ice in a tupperware & put sliced fruit in there, and put it in the punch bowl. very pretty. i also recommend using organic fruits since you will be drinking the juices & oils from the skins. don't wanna risk any pesticide getting in your drink, as the fruits will be soaking for hours.

Excellent. I made mine the night before, and didn't add as much sugar. I think the key is leaving it overnight though since I quickly whipped up a second batch (by popular demand!) and it was good- but not AS good. Every time someone tried it they got a look of amazement. lol It was such a hit!

I LOVED this sangria! I made it for our house warming party, and scaled it to 50 servings. I used a sweeter red wine, and cut out some of the sugar. I also added some apple pieces. Everyone LOVED it, even my sister and mother who don't drink. Great Recipe! Cant wait to make it again!!

My first time making sangria, but certainly won't be my last! I made this for a birthday party that I was hosting, and I made 4x the recipe but didn't have much left over! I'll definitely make this for our next party. Set it out in a punch bowl...it makes a beautiful presentation! Thanks for sharing!
This is the ONLY Sangria recipe I use!!! FANTASTIC!!
I made using white wine because that was all I had on hand never the less it was great...turned out to be a hit
This stuff was awesome! I omitted the sugar and cherries. Didn't need it at all.

This is FABULOUS! I made a double batch for a party and even the "non drinkers" were drinking this! I omitted the sugar and filled 1/2 of the glass with sangria and topped it off with ginger-ale! It was a hit at my party!
My friends from Spain love when I make this Sangria!

This recipe is AMAZING!!! I made this over the summer when my mother in law came up from FL. The only change that I made was adding different fruits. I added blueberries, mango, pineapple, and strawberries. I used brandy, Ed Hardy Sangria red wine and peachtree schnapps!
I registered just to rate how great this recipe is! Omited the lemoade, sugar and carbonated water. It was delicious!! :)
Haha! Just won a Columbus day sangria contest! Was sure to give u the props:)

I've made this recipe or some version of it, as it is a very flexible and forgiving recipe, tons of times. And it's always a huge it! The only thing I have never done was add the sugar. If you use a splash of sprite or gingerale it has plenty of sweetness. This has been dubbed by friends as "the hold sangria." Enjoy!

I madee thisw recipe for a party of around 22 adults and we blew through 4 gallons in no time Was so awesome I received calls the next day for the recipe. May have another party just so I can make some more HUGE hit!! This is the recipe I have always been searching for and didn't have to go to the ends of the earth for ingredients! Used the gingerale instead of carbonated water. Great tip!
Gets no better than this. The perfect beverage to top off a Sunday afternoon. I've made it before and I'll make it again!
Wow was a hit very citrus and colorful.
Used what I had on hand. Used blackberry brandy, along with peach schnapps. Added in lemon, lime, apple, and pears. Let it sit for a good 24hr. I then used ginger ale instead of a lemon soda.
Yummy!

This was incredible! I have a huge sweet tooth but didn't need any sugar at all. I did accidently dump in too much lemonaid concentrate but I think this is a very flexible recipe that you can have fun with. Thanks for sharing.

Definately some of the best sangria I've had. I made this for a family gathering and everyone loved it. Next time I'm going to let it sit for two nights instead of one because I had some leftover and drank it the next day and it was even better!
This recipe is very similar to my mother's. Love it!!! Highly recommend this as a good base recipe.

Absolute best recipie EVER! I made this for a party hosted by my latino friend. I was so nervous as I was the only non-latino at this party. OMG, it was a success. I am asked to bring this to every party she host now. Thank you, thank you! I made it once and let it only soak a couple of hours. It was good, but the key is to let it sit overnight!
all I can say is yumm!

I just made this recipe for my BBQ that I had today. It was GREAT! I read all the reviews before making it and these are the changes I made. Im not a cherry person so did not include cherries. I used fresh squeezed orange and lemon juices when it called for that. i also used clementines instead of oranges, the flavor is so much better I think. I only used 3 rounded tbsp sugar as Im not a sweet drink person. I added 2 fresh nectarines and 2 cups fresh pineapple. I used sprite instead of club soda or gingerale as I had omitted some of the sugar. This was truly an excellent Sangria and several people insisted on the recipe before they left. It was a serious hit. You wont be dissappointed.

Awesome.... I was making this for a large group and had a hard time figguring out how much alcohol to buy. Here is what I bought to make enough to make 5 times the recipe (30 servings). 4L jug of Carlo Rossi Sangria wine, 750 ml bottel of Blackberry Brandy, 750 ml bottel of triple sec, and a couple of 2 liter bottles ginger ale. I used all the wine and most of the brandy and triple sec. I added the ginger ale before serving and only used about a 1/2 a bottle (wanted to add more so that it would serve more people but the taste testers said it was great and not to add any more). I did not use sugar and made it the night before. I should have made the serving for 60 or even more because it went fast. Will absolutly make again, and I dont even like wine!!
This is awesome....very potent tho!!!
This was great. I used less sugar than it called for and added some other frozen fruits (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)

We have made this countless times and everyone always loves it! I don't always use all of the fruit that it calls for, and I tend to skip the sugar but instead add Sprite - though I have followed the recipe to the letter, and it is great either way - just personal preference on taste. Definitely a keeper!
LOVE this recipe! I made the recipe as is & it's fabulous.

I loved this recipe. The second and third time I made it I made some modifications: I eliminated the optional sugar and poured 1/8 cup of the maraschino cherry juice into the mixture. I used 3 cans of 7-Up instead of carbonated water, and floated 1 quart of rainbow sherbert on the top. I colored some water in oleo tubs and froze it for ice. Very pretty; very tasty.
I have made this sangria twice now for summer cookouts and it is gone in literally minutes. Definitely make it the night before...just be carefu because it does sneak up on you ;)
OK. It wasn't as sweet and light as I would've liked it to be.

Maybe it was just us, because this recipe got so many rave reviews, but we found it to be way too strong for our liking. I think I'll make it again and cut back a little on the brandy and triple sec. *FOLLOW UP* - I made this recipe again, this time using rum instead of the brandy. I cut back just a tad on the rum and triple sec, and used the ginger ale in place of the carbonated water. HUGE improvement. I would say this is now a 4 star recipe. Also, do not like maraschino cherries so I used strawberries instead.

this is really good- i make white zinfandel/rose sangria with this recipe- u can also put less brandy to make it less stronger and play around with the lemon juice and sprite/ginger ail instead of carbonated water
This was excellent!! I tripled the recipe for a cookout, but did not add any sugar, cherries or carbonated beverage. Everyone loved it!

GREAT sangria recipe! I have adapted the fruits some and use nectarines, apples, and oranges in the mix and add a slice of lemon to the edge of the glass so that the citrus rides with every sip. I have used this recipe to make sangria for a lot of summer parties and everyone just loves it. Allowing to sit overnight/over 12 hours is definitely key. I have adapted the recipe slightly, and this is what I've found really brings out all the flavors. I mix the fruit with the brandy, sugar, and triple sec 2 days beforehand. Then the next day I add the orange juice, lemon juice, lemonade concentrate, and red wine. Then I mix the carbonated water individually for each drink the next day. Makes for a wonderfully refreshing summer drink!
Simple, easy, delicious. The hardest part was deciding on a good dry red wine. I would suggest making a double batch if you're having friends over because it goes really FAST!
The best Sangria I've ever had. Thanks for the recipe!
grat i add 1/2 cup of coconut rum....yum!
This is a party favorite. Perfect blend of flavors and adds sweetness to the dry wine. Make a double recipe b/c it will disappear fast!
Yummy, tasty, sneaky! Love it!
oh my! this is the best sangria ever! better make 2 batches because you're gonna want extra! i used homeade peach brandy in mine and it was wonderful!
This was ok, but I felt it had the flavor of the orange & lemon rinds which made it bitter. It was better with served with ginerale.
I followed the recipe exactly, turned out great!
Made this for a dinner party and everyone loved it! I used orange curacao instead of triple sec and used only one can of ginger ale without sugar. We had everyone asking for seconds and more!

this recipe is a real hit!!! I followed some reviewers recommendations - use cherry brandy and add raspberries... I also skewered fruit and garnished each drink before serving. everyone love it!! I trippled the recipe for 6 people and it was just enough

Great recipe! Used peach schnapps instead of the triple sec, ginger ale instead of carbonated water, and left out the cherries. Made the recipe for approximately 20 guests. Super-easy preparation the night before. It was a huge hit.

Wonderful! Brilliant! I tweaked it slightly, made double the amount in the recipe but added to the mix: 4 chopped oranges, 2 chopped apples, half a litre strawberries and a little gingerale (prior to serving) Let all the ingredients soak overnight in the fridge. Everyone loved it! :-D

Love this recipe! Peach schnapps instead of triple sec is good. It can also make a great take along to a potluck. Make in a ziploc bag the night before, put in a cooler, then pour into a pitcher with a little ice and club soda at your destination.

Like most people, I dropped the sugar and carbonated water in favor of ginger ale, and let it sit for a day. I made a double batch, and it was gone long, long before the wine, beer, and margaritas were.

I have made this recipe twice, and it turned out great both times. The first time I followed the recipe but used rum instead of brandy (because I had it on hand). I also added a pear to the fruit mix and left out the sugar. Turned out great! The second time my fiance added the whole can of lemonade concentrate instead of 1/3 a cup so we didn't add any ginger ale or carbonated water and it was still good! It got great reviews from all who tried it.

comparing this to some wine drink from Mexico ... Sangria is Spanish NOT Mexican. Spain has European influences and Mexico has S.A. Indian influences - in both food and drink. Different cultures entirely. Be careful of rating apples to oranges ... Oh, floating sliced apples in this is nice too. Remember to eat the fruit ... Yummo!

Best Sangria you will ever have hands down!! But beware, it does come up and bite you!! I substitute Orange Crush for the orange juice, use the sugar, and NO carbonated water. Better with a dry oak and spice red wine, then its not too fruity. All my friends LOVE this recipe!!

So over the many times that I have made this recipe my aunt and I have made it to our liking: use blackberry brandy use frozen raspberry lemonade concentrate leave out the sugar (way too sweet with it) mix everything together and pour into the glasses then add a little of the cherry juice and the carbonated water to each glass instead of the whole pitcher. We usually omit the lemons and limes because we dont have them around as often.

This was a great recipe! I made a few changes - no sugar, cherries or water. But I did add Malibu coconut rum and fresh lemonade instead of frozen. I think it would taste equally as good with spiced rum or peach schnapps as someone else suggested. Thanks for sharing!

This was fantastic! I love the way the fruit mellows the wine and the wine mellows the fruit - such great compliments to each other. I made pretty much exactly as is except i omitted the cherries and the triple sec. i also omitted the sugar as the lemonade concentrate is sweet enough for my tastes. W/out the sugar and triple sec, its the perfect amount of semi-sweetness...not too much as to not be refreshing but just enough to make it a treat. I took the suggestion of adding the soda as i was serving it for a little bit of fizz. I made with Carnitas for a going away dinner - guests were very impressed as this is a very "fancy" yet easy beverage to serve - very fun! Can't wait to make again.

I've never made sangria before, and I've had a few good ones and more bad ones at restaurants. I followed the reviewers' advice and used peach schnapps instead of triple sec, 7UP instead of soda water/sugar, and included raspberries. I made two batches and it was really really good! Even my friends who don't like wine or sweeter drinks enjoyed this...even my non-drinking mother had some and loved it!
We had a World Cup Cuisine party and people are still raving about this amazing sangria. Warning !! it is potent.

I've made 3 other Sangria recipes and this is by far the best. For the triple sec I use Cointreau but I think any triple sec would be just as good. I just happen to keep Cointreau in stock. For the brandy I use Wild Cherry brandy. I omit the sugar completely. I mix it all up, then let it sit for about 18 - 24 hours. Then I take a glass, fill it with ice cubes, fill about 1/3 to 1/2 of the glass with Club Soda, then top it with the Sangria. Oh My Goodness...it is the best! I would have never thought that using club soda would be my preference, but it most definitely IS. I made a triple batch for the Fourth of July (only 4 of us total) and I had to make another triple batch the morning of the second day, or we would have run out. Try this recipe exactly as it is written, and then you can easily make any adjustments you prefer. However be forewarned, you need to plan ahead a wee bit, because if you let it sit over night, or even 4-6 hours, it is much much better. Everything seeps and melds together and mixes just wonderfully.I think that is the secret to this particular Sangria recipe.
I loved this recipe! I made a mistake and added a little extra sugar, but it still turned out great!

This Sangria is one of the best I have tried ~ I was taught to add the fruit and sugar first. I take my wooden spoon and break up some of the fruit to release their flavors ~ other than that I use ginger ale (about 1 can per bottle) ~ delicious! thank you for sharing!

This is a great recipe for Sangria. Do refrigate it overnight because that makes it sooo much better. Very smooth. Good the first day but GREAT the second. I did subsititure Grenadine for the sugar - adds the sweetness and enhances the color. Definitely add the club soda right before serving - gives it a sizzle!
So tasty! Best homemade sangria I've ever had - and my guests adored it!
Best sangria I've ever had! I can't believe I made it! I made 2 batches for a small party and ran out. Next time I will make more!

I have made this several times and it is always a hit at my get togethers...people beg for me to make. I don't use ginger ale or club soda, just with some sugar depending on how sweet I want it. It does better if it sits in the fridge for a few hours before serving.
If you want a WOW sangria try this receipe. I made 2 pitchers. Everyone was complimenting it was the best sangria they ever drinked. Thank you for sharing the receipe.

This is a delicious recipe! If you are using a sweeter red wine, you may want to adjust to less sugar added (taste it first!) otherwise it ends up being sugar overload. You don't need to use an expensive wine either- all the ingredients meld together really well to make this a really enjoyable drink!
I like to use a frozen berry mixture as the fruit in addition to the orange and lime slices. Never lasts very long at parties!
I had high hopes for this sangria for our July 4th party, but unfortunately it was a dud. :-( Maybe it was the rain...but no one really raved about it or came back for more.

User: Noemi - No way is she a
Review: I made this and it was supposed to be for our 4th of july celebration, but it never made it! It was so good we drank it up the day before.."taste testing" it!

So good and very potent...so be careful. Also Sangria is a very forgiving recipes with lots of different variations. I used a sparkling wine and skipped the sprite/soda. Didn't have orange juice, so added lemonade. Perfect summer concoction!
I make this every year for our pool party, and everyone loves it.

Excellent recipe! It was a huge success at my son's graduation party! I used a low cost merlot and cherry brandy, skipped the sugar and offered seltzer on the side for anyone who wanted to add it. I quadrupled the recipe so I would have enough to last the entire gathering...which I didn't! Many asked for the recipe before departing the event. I have made it since using apricot brandy, which was also wonderful. I will caution you that if you have left-overs, remove the fruit. If it sits more than a day, the skin's give it a bitter aftertaste. An excellent summer-time offering! Thanks for the recipe!

This is a fantastic recipe! I tripled the recipe but cut the sugar by half and left a bottle of ginger ale and a bottle of club soda next to the dispenser (a 3-gallon clear container with a spigot at the bottom and an opening at the top for the ladle) in case anyone wanted to lighten it up.

this was a perfect sangria for the my "girls day at the pool"" party. i didn't use the sugar or the carbonated water, i used ginger ale before serving. yummy! i will make this over and over for all the parties.

OMG, this is SO GOOD! I made a quadruple batch for my 40th birthday party and it was a huge hit! I used frozen berries in addition to the fruits mentioned in the recipe. I also used an inexpensive Shiraz for the wine and let the mixture sit in the fridge for about 36 hrs. (After doing some online research regarding which type of wine to use, I found out that Sangria was originally made with inexpensive table wines to enhance their flavor, which makes complete sense and did the job! I can't see using an expensive wine just to doctor it up?!) I added Ginger Ale right before serving. Myself and my guests highly recommend this recipe!
I never use the brandy and it is still gets rave reviews with my friends.

I served this with a giant foccacia bread sandwich, and pepperoni salad to friends and they loved it. I did not use the cherries, but followed the recipe exactly. I served it straight without the seltzer water. I will be sure to double it next time. WONDEFUL!

This was SO good!! I did add the sugar and 2 cups of gingerale. I think it would be fine without the sugar, too. The men didn't want any, thank goodness because my mother and I polished off the whole thing!

This was terrific! I used Ginger Ale instead of the club soda, and Orange Liquer instead of Triple Sec. I left out the sugar but added 3/4 cup of Peach Schnapps I let everything sit overnight and this was SOOOO good the next day! Thank you!
perfect recipe (used sprite instead of carbonated water)
Delicious Sangria. We used the Seven-Up variation without the added sugar and it was a crowd pleaser. It was sweet enough and full of flavor.

First time making Sangria. Was a hit at dinner. Doubled the recipe for 6 people and ran out halfway through. Should at least triple if you have some sangria lovers / heavy drinkers. Used half the brandy, and 3/4 of ginger ale (instead of carbonated water) called for. No lemon juice, used more frozen lemonade instead. No sugar.

I loved this!! I made it exactly as is EXCEPT that I omitted the sugar. I don't like super sweet drinks and I found that omitting the sugar made it taste perfect for me. I used merlot for the wine. I made it for a party and it was a huge hit- however it was very potent! But in a good way. I will definitely be making this again- this weekend in fact!

I made this recipe to serve runners in the South Okanagan Winery Association Half Corked Marathon (May 30). I made a batch that used 24 bottles of wine. Rave reviews from all the runners, and requests for the recipe. Kudos to HJACOBY.
pretty fruity prefered squirt instead of gingerale and used blackberry brandy and peach schnapps

This was GREAT, just like I remember from Spain. I left out the cherries, sugar & club soda. However, next time I will only let the fruit stay in for about 8 hours. I noticed that it tasted fabulous then, but after I let it sit overnight, the rind gave the sangria a bitter taste.
SO YUMMY!!!! You need to definately at least double the recipe. One batch is not enough! I didn't try it with the soda. I like it non-carbonated. Can't wait to make it again!
This recipe is AWESOME!!! The Sangria is a huge hit! It is so easy to perpare. For a better taste let it sit overnight.

this sangria was fantastic. i made it for a playdate luncheon and the other mamas swooned. i did substitute gin and cointreau for the brandy and triple sec; it was a wonderful crisp drink. i skipped the sugar and marischino cherries, and added about 1/2 the ginger ale. warning, this drink packs a POWERFUL punch, and it is easy to drink a lot without realizing it. needless to say, everyone was at my house for a good long time. but even the non-sangria fans were true devotees before the day ended. last word of advice: make a double recipe at LEAST!

Very nice and refreshing. Very easy to make too! I used sprite, and i like how i could play with the flavor by adding more or less sprite in my cup... also yes it keeps tatsing better the longer the flavors have a chance to blend :)
One of the best Sangria recipes I have ever had. We used sprite instead of soda water to add a little sweetness and used frozen mixed fruit. It is great!
A bit hit. I also added other fruit like apples and pears. Had to sub brandy with rum but was still awesome!! Will def make this again.

So yummy! Got rave review from all of our guests. We like our sangria sweeter, so we used ginger ale and added the optional sugar. We left out the marashino cherries, but followed the rest of the recipe to a T. This was a perfect drink for a beautiful, sunny, warm evening. We'll be making this a bunch this summer!

Everyone was raving about this. Made it on Mother's Day for a bapstism/combined with Mother's Day lunch reception. It was the only thing most people drank! I skipped the cherries and carbonated water/ginger ale but did use the sugar. Used a relatively cheap Cabarnet Sauvignon for the wine.
YUM! Made this for a party, it was a huge hit!
This was awesome! Definitely a crowd pleaser at any family gathering, cook-out, etc. Everyone loves this and I always find that I cannot make enough.
Made this for a party and they drank 3 full bowls of it!
I used a sweet red wine and this was really good!! My family LOVED it!
This drink is soo good and it's stronger than it tastes.

Excellent!!! I followed the suggestion of others here and left out the sugar, opting instead for gingerale. Also added in fresh raspberries. It definetly needs to hang out over night which is so hard to do but it so worth it! Everyone loved it but most importantly I LOVED IT!
Fab! Add 12-16 oz of frozen blueberries and or strawberries!
Made this for my pig roast..I had increased it to serve 100 ppl and eveyone loved it!!
You can add also orange soda and some diced apples a very good recipe!
yikes! I doubled this recipe for a party of 8 and it turned out only 3 of us were drinking. Delicious and what a fun night! We finished it...
Mmmmm.......Easy to tweek to your own liking!!!! I added extra brandy and a bit more orange juice!!-----Oh and cheap wine works wonderfully!!
I make this sangria every single summer. Nothing beats lounging on the back deck with a glass of this delicious drink in hand.
Love this recipe! I use sprite in place of club soda and frozen orange juice ice cubes.

WONDERFUL. I made this for a party of 23, it's sweet but not too sweet and as several other reviewers have mentioned... the brandy IS key. I used a dry Barefoot wine and went ahead and threw a few more fruits in just to add more color to the drink since this was a honeymoon-themed bridal party (threw in some kiwi and strawberries). You really can't go wrong with the fruit combos. Made this the day before the party (a must in order to allow all flavors to blend and fruit to marinate) but come day of the party totally forgot to add ginger ale and carbonated water (I was going to make two batches to see which was more popular among the guests), but the drink was a huge hit even without the fizz!

the. best. sangria. EVER!! Wow! Thanks for such a rockin' recipe!! I've substituted sunny D for the OJ and drank it without letting the fruit soak (just squeezed the fruit so the juices came out) and it was STILL fantastic! Doesn't last for very long around my house!! If I could give this 10 stars, I would!

This Sangria is really good. I have made it several times and depending on time & what I have on hand, I add or omit ingredients. Any way you make it, it's really tasty! As other reviewers have stated..go slow! it's so good it sneaks up on you!

This was so good!! I don't like wine so I was nervous but it was great. I made this for my birhday party and everyone loved it, my only advice is make lots of it because it goes fast. I made the recipe as is and added the sugar.

I wanted to make a drink for my housewarming party and my husband sugested a Sangria. I am not a wine drinker so I did a little research and ended up using 2 large bottles of Shiraz Cabernet and quadrupled the recipe. The only thing I left out was the lemon juice, I had only bought one lemon to slice up and since I used the frozen lemonaid I figured it would be ok. I also took note of some of other comments and added some cherry juice. I made this the night before and added the ginger ale before serving. The Sangria got raving complments, it was the hit of the party and there was not a drop left! Definitley a keeper, I can't wait to make this on a warm summer night!!
Excellent sangria recipe! Made it for a shower today and it got great reviews. Didn't change a thing, but we didn't add any fizz because I prefer sangria that way.

I made this for a large party and it was a huge hit! I've just been asked to make it for the next party since everyone loved it so much. The balance of taste was perfect, very smooth. I couldn't find the cherries so I just used oranges, lemons and limes, delicious! Thanks
Outstanding!!! I will be serving this all summer!!

Great. Great. Great. Made it a day ahead of time to have the flavors blend, but me and my husband couldn't wait so we drank half of it the night before our party. I had to put together another batch before and during the party. i also added apples b/c i made it in the winter. I would most likely make this again in the summer and add peaches and grapes. I also used Seltzer water cut down on the sweetness.

Very, very good. I made it the night before as recommended. I substituted limeade concentrate because I had it on hand. I omitted the cherries and added green apple. I did use a little bit of sugar, maybe 2 tablespoons, to add just the right amount of sweetness. It was a big hit at our party- I only wish I'd made more!

This recipe is the best. I have made it many times with different types of wine (I think Merlot is my favorite), and it always disappears right away. I do add the sugar, but I omit the carbonated water. I think it is best about 2 hours after you make it. Thanks for the great recipe!

This is fantastic as written.. YUM! I made a second bacth and added bacardi limon, and a can of pineapples, and Oh so good. Basically you can throw in whatever you want on top of this recipe and It will be good! Thanks for sharing!
Great recipe! will use it over and over again.
Amazing!!!!
SIMPLY THE BEST.... love love love this recipe! Thanks so much!
I love this and have made lots of different variations with the same basic ratios. It is my favorite Sangria I've found!

Excellent Sangria! Left out the frozen lemonade (didn't have any) so I increased the sugar and lemon juice. It was delicious. Double batch was gone within an hour. Be ready...this is so tasty its easy to forget how potent it is!
Awesome Sangria! Drink slowly, though, this one sneaks up you. Best Sangria I've ever had - better than restaurant versions!
Love it! Every year I make this for New Years and it is gone in a matter of minutes!
yuuuum!! I can't wait to try with different kinds of fruit juice!!!

I made this sangria for my family party and I double the recipe to make a hugh punch bowl full of it. I was worried it was going to go to waste but instead it was gone half way through my party!!! We ended up using all the fruit left on the bottom to make other mixed drinks because it tasted so good. I commited this recipe to memory and will use it many more times. I did use the white sugar and I also used the maraschinl cherry juice as well and it tasted spectacular.
sssooo fab!! didn't have time to let it sit overnight the first time and still loved it1!! am going to make it again for mlk day and goign to let it sit, can't wait!!
This was such a hit! Follow the recipe exactly and you will not be disapointed!

This is a great recipe. I made it New Year's Eve for some friends and they all raved about it. I did cut back on the sugar a little. I am a little bit of a light weight so I added some Sprite to mine and it was fantastic! Can't wait to make this during the summer!

The best! I've made this several times since Thanksgiving (when I first made it). It's now frequently requested by my friends. :o) ***UPDATE*** I've since doubled the wine and I use a table red or a red rose wine; bump up the lemon juice to 1/3 c.; double the triple sec, orange juice, frozen lemonade, and sugar; and leave the brandy at 1/2 c. Delish! I finally have it right.
Love love love it! I have made this 3 times and have always doubled it! I only add a sprinkle of the sugar. And, it's true, even the guys love this! Thank you for sharing.
best sangria i've ever tasted! super easy to make and has a kick that's perfect. i've tried a lot of sangria and this one is by far the best ever! enjoy!
Great stuff! made exactly as is and served ginger ale on the side for those that wanted it! Stout and goes down waaay to easy!

Made this for a Mexican themed dinner I was invited to. Was in a rush and didn't fully read directions, and made it a few hours before the party. It was still delicious, but my neighbor said the left over drink was even better the next day...so make the day before for best results!

This was a big hit. Instead of dry red wine I used the Boones Sangria. I used 8 bottles so this was a much cheaper alternative, and this still tasted GREAT!! I also soaked my fruit in the triple sec and stuck it in the frezzer overnight. This was a huge hit at our Holiday Party.

I used ginger ale. It seemed a little strong, but that may have been the wine I used. We added ice to our glasses to "water down" a bit. All in all, it was good and enjoyed by everyone. UPDATE: Since my original review, I have made this several times. It has become a holiday tradition. I make two double batches the night before, and add ginger ale when it's time to serve. I've even added an extra bottle of wine when the quantity starts getting low to make it through the party! ;)
Very potent as well. :)
Seriously! The best Sangria I've ever had. No need to tweak anything!Thanks for the recipie:)

This was a hit at a party I had; just be careful, because it packs a punch! I doubled the recipe but found it to be too citrusy, so on my next try I didn't double the fruit slices, and it was perfect. I also used ginger ale in place of club soda, but I'm sure it would be good without. Don't forget the cherries - I love the flavor they add!
Best I've ever had!! Like candy!
I didn't have lemonade concentrate or the carbonated water but had everything else. This had very good flavor, but wasn't as thick as I get in Mexican Town so only 4 stars
This sangria is AWESOME! I do NOT add the sugar or cherries (ew) or carbonated water...you don't need any of those! But I follow the rest exactly! I make this almost every week now! Soooo good!

This recipe is great. Every time I make this drink I run out so the last time I multiplied the amount by 5 ((I used a huge stockpot to chill overnight). Here is a tip should you have leftovers, if you use fresh citrus with the rinds, remove them as they will cause the drink to become bitter.
Yum! Tastes like punch ... and packs one too!
Excellent!!! I made exactly as written and added the carbonated water just before serving. I will definitely make this again, thanks for sharing!!!
AWESOME, everyone at my party loved it, quick and easy to make too.

Delicious! I omitted the sugar because it was sweet enough. For one batch I used Menage a Trois, and the second batch I used Blackstone Merlot. Both were delicious, and the fruits are great to nibble on too. :)
Very very dangerous drink!

I have never made nor tasted a better Sangria in my life. Every time I have made this my guests drink it like water. I cannot make enough of it. I usually make it exactly as written, minus the club soda, but I have used different fruit combinations, changed the amounts of sugar and/or juice based on what I have, and it still comes out perfect. I think the key is the balance between the brandy and the triple sec...mess with that and it doesn't taste quite the same. One thing is for sure is that you and your guests wil be loaded and happy. One reviewer said "dangerous" and "excellent" in reference to this recipe. Agreed and agreed.

SO FREAKING GOOD!! I added chopped up granny smith apples and some peach schnapps. I skipped the lemon juice and added extra frozen lemonade. I didn't need to add anything to sweeten it up. I just used the soda water and it was perfect!

Oh so delicious :) I left out the sugar also as I didn't want this to be like punch. I added the club soda and glad I did because it lightened it a bit. The punch bowl was empty by the time we finished our appetizers!

I was so hoping to love this recipe as there were lots of 5-star reviews, but honestly, I didn't like it. I tried making it twice. Once with Shiraz and once with Merlot. Not sure if it's because I used fresh-squeezed orange juice -- the oranges weren't the sweetest or tastiest, so maybe that's why. I'm going to try the white peach sangria. Maybe that one would suit me better.
One word: Dangerous!! Excellent! Oops...that's two words.
Good recipe. I have another recipe with much less ingredients and I think it tastes better! I will use this when I want to make sangria completly from scratch.
Had with the girls. Increase OJ and sugar. very tasety!

This sangria is delicious! I made it for my sister's bridal shower and received rave reviews. I used barcardi instead of brandy, omitted the frozen lemonade concentrate, and did not add the sugar. I've made it since and everytime I have, people are in love with it.
Followed recipe using fresh juices and did not include club soda. Allowed to "marinate" for 24 hours. Used cheap spanish red wine and cheap brandy. Slightly sweet and very fruity. Thanks!
Everyone loved it and wanted the recipe.

It's difficult to find a balance between the alcohol and fruit juice flavors, but this recipe does that very well. The last time I used this recipe, I substituted the frozen lemonade concentrate with a limeade concentrate (it's what was on hand) and the finished product was slightly more tangy, which I enjoyed more.

Excellent! Brandy is a must, as well as letting it sit for 24 hours. I didnt use triple sec, limeade, lemon juice or ginger ale. I added papaya, mango and strawberry chunks and let them sit for the 24 hours, then i served over frozen pineapple chunks. I tripled the recipe and it went quick. I used Carlos Rossi Sangria... will definately make again. oh, and its super strong when its freshly made, so letting it sit as long as possible is key in blending the flavors and toning it down.

Wow! This is a great recipe. The brandy really gives it a kick, along with all those juices and fruit. I put mine in a decorative glass iced tea jar, and it looked fabulous (plus was easy for guests to help themselves). Will definitely make again.

YUMMY! I also added apples..followed entire recipe but no carbonated water..it was perfect, sweet but not too sweet. I had another recipe last wk and it was awful! this is the right combo..I used Lambrussco for the wine, I know you can pretty much use whatever but I like specifics and this wine worked perfectly and was recommended.
I cut the sugar in half- other than that it's great! i make this lal the time now! I double the recipe and use a bottle of zinfandel and a bottle of shiraz. turns out perfect every time!
I made this for a baby shower and had many requests for the recipe. One guest told me that she tried 6 or 7 recipes and this was the best she has had. I agree.

I made a double batch of this for a big gathering and everyone loved it!! I used white wine (as there were going to be kids running around and didn't want red wine drinks getting knocked over onto the carpet!) and ginger ale and it was excellent. Will definitely try with the red wine next time...when there are only grown ups around!
Took this to the same dinner party as the Basque Cake (yum); it was very well received and we'll make it again.

This Stuff is Fantastic! I followed the recipe. Put in lots of fruit, let it set over night, added ginger ale right before I served it. It was a huge hit. Even my mom, who doesn't drink much liked it.

Was trying to find an intersting drink to serve at my wedding. Adapted a bit and made berry sangria instead. Added frozen strawberry and raspberry juice. Then, put in some berry arbor mist with rose wine. Diluted it with strawberry sparkling water. Put some frozen strawberries and raspberries for an added touch. Anyone that gets married requests my berry sangria!
This was fantastic! We all "felt no pain" when we finished this punch bowl! It was delicious!!

I used Sprite instead of carbonated water. Put in lime, orange, mar cherries, and grapes. We doubled the recipe and a party of 6 had approx 2 drinks a piece. The fruit was the best part! Chills for 24 hours before it was served. It was a hit and will make again~

Great base recipe. A little too much citrus for me though. On my second batch I followed the directions exactly, except I omitted the lemon juice, limes and lemons. Also, omitted the club soda/ginger ale. I added mangos and pears (plus the oranges) instead and it was fabulous!! I served it at a neighborhood party and it was a hit.

Delicious and STRONG! I was going to a potluck lunch at a friend's house where I didn't know the other guests. The sangria was a hit the second I walked through the door - who doesn't like sangria? After a glass of this stuff, forget about being shy! Be particularly careful measuring out the frozen lemonade as it changes the sweetness of the recipe dramatically. Think about making two batches and letting them marinate with the sliced fruit overnight. My first batch was gone really fast! Definitely worth purchasing the hard liquor.
Made a double batch and was glad I did...I forgot the OJ, I let it sit overnight, but tried a glass before bedtime and I rested well. ;-)

I use 7-Up instead of sugar and carbonated water, and I make sure to slice the fruits thickly, otherwise I find it's a little too much citrus for my taste. I've also been adding red raspberries and pineapples recently - super good!
Well it may not have been the very best I ever had but it certainly was good, refreshing and wonderful on a hot Texas day.
Delicious! This is best Sangria recipe I have found. It definitely needs to sit overnight for best flavor.

This recipe is unbeatable! I made 6 gallons of this the night before as one of the cocktails for my daughter's wedding. It was all gone during the appetizers!!! (and we had an open bar - guests could have anything) Everyone LOVED IT!!!

This is always a hit. I eliminate the cherries, can't stand them, and add whatever fruit/berries I have laying around. Sliced pears, limes, oranges and whole blackberries is my favorite combination. If there's time, I like to make it the night before, and add cold ginger ale just before serving.
Very tasty.
Made it exactly as written. Perfect!
Made a big 5gal cooler of this and everyone loved it....works great for a taco tuesday fiesta!
Fantastic! I made a big batch then let it sit over night. It was the hit of my Mexican Fiesta Party! I had to give thi recipe out to everyone at party Thanks for a winner
The sangria turned out great. My boyfriend, who is a sangria lover, said that this was the best he ever had and that he would pay for a drink like this!
everyone loved it

I made a double batch (12 cups). For reference; all the ingredients came to 1 gallon. I did not add the sugar and opted for the Ginger Ale instead. I also left all the fruit in the pitcher and instead of floating slices I put a pineapple spear in with each 8 oz. glass (juice glass). It was a hit.
I made 3 batches of this for bunko last night and it got very good reviews. A nice change from the usual Margaritas. I tried Club Soda and also Sprite Zero---I definitely preferred the Sprite.

I completely agree with everyone on how great this Sangria is!! My only recommendation is that you don't just use one batch. The one and only batch I made went in about 5 minutes. It can serve about 5-6 servings. If you have a big crowd or you think that your guests will want more than one glass, double or triple this recipe! (Also, I omitted the sugar and water and added Sprite instead). It was Incredible!
This is heaven on a hot summer day!!!! Omit the sugar and swap sprite for the carbonated water. For the wine I recommend Carlo Rossi Cabernet - this giant jug so you can make a couple batches!

My friends and I have recently starting trying the Sangria at our favorite restaurants. So, I made this for a group of women at a jewelry party. I used Ginger Ale instead of the club soda. It was a HUGE hit and several people asked for the recipe! I will definitely make this time and again!
This is very good and strong!
Trader Joe's has a peach-mango-orange juice that is amazing in this sangria (instead of plain oj).
Super yummy - Easy recipe! Has a serious kick!!
This was fantastic and will be regularly made in my house now!! I used ginger ale as a topper, really tasty. Only problem is it ran out too fast :)
This is a real nice treat, will make this on a regular basis
Wonderful! This has become my favorite summer drink. My guests love it and never fail to ask for the recipe. I don't alter the recipe at all because it's perfect as is. Thanks for sharing.
I love this Sangria! After visiting Tapas restaurant in NYC, I tried hard to find a similar recipe to make my own, and this one is the closest by far.
This recipe is the best one yet. I quadrupled the recipe and it went in about an hour! I added some more fruit than what is in the recipe and it does not need the carbonated water. Thanks!
doubled sugar and added 1 cup of prepared minute maid lemonade or us ginger ale to sweeten
i served this at my backyard wedding, and everyone raved over it and wanted the recipe.
Oh dear... this stuff knocked everyone off their feet (both in taste and in alcohol content...) GREAT recipe!!

I made this last summer for a big outdoor birthday party. Everyone drank this instead of the beer, and I had an entire keg left over. It was the best sangria I have ever made or drank! I did cut up apples, so there would be more edible pieces. I did make it the night before, and it was perfect.

The crowd pleaser! It vanishes everytime I make it! Only added about a tablespoon of sugar. This time I let people take it how they wanted it...over gingerale, stright up or over Asti Spumante champaigne. SOOO GOOD! Make sure you double or triple the recipe and make a day ahead.

Finally found a keeper Sangria recipe!!! Almost gave up making it because it came out too tart. No leftovers with this recipe. I didn't use the sugar but the maraschino cherry juice (to taste) 1/2 jar juice to start with. Also I used ginger ale (instead of c. water) but let everyone add it themselves to their own taste! Everyone liked it!

made this recipe twice now, first time followed recipe exactly, little to tart for my liking, second time left out the lemon juice. and i had let it steep for 24 hours(hard thing to do, but well worth it!)
Awesome!! I also added rum, strawberries, pineapple and a peach to the mix and it was delicious!!!
I followed the recipe and everyone LOVED it!!
this was a huge hit last night. I made a double batch, but ran out.

I made this recipe for my sisters bridal shower. I was very excited since the reviews were so great. I was pretty disappointed. It was very tart. I added ginger ale and some extra sugar and used a Merlot. I'm going to try another batch tonight and use less lemon. Hopefully that will work out better.

I made this for my husband's family reunion and it was a huge hit! Guys who said they didn't care for Sangria were coming back for more and the beer was hardly touched. I used carbonated water - otherwise it might be too concentrated. I cut up the fruit into smaller pieces as other suggested. Also, know that while the taste is smooth, this stuff is potent. I'll definitely make it again.
Very good, and easy. I threw some strawberries in too..yummy!
Delicious! After the first batch finished people asked for more. It is a quick fix and very tasty. I substituted Lemon/Lime soda for the carbonated water and it was great if you like a sweet drink.

Made this for a neighborhood pool party and everyone loved it. A very forgiving recipe, followed the recipe until I found I had another bottle of opened red wine so threw it in along with a some of the other ingredients, let it sit all day and served it up.
Delicious, and DO make it a day ahead! I substituted 7-up for the sugar and sparkling water, and grand marnier for the triple sec, also used grapes instead of cherries. again, delicious!
SO SO good. I added apples. I poured in a glass with frozen grapes (no ice needed that way) about 3/4 wine to 1/4 sprite.
This recipe is the BOMB! We have made for numerous parties and it's always a hit!

I had never made Sangria before...but always wanted to. I stumbled upon this recipe in the Summer of 2008. I make it with my sister (it's our new backyard BBQ ritual) and we vary it each time. Our guest feel that our Summer gatherings are just not complete without this EXCELLENT beverage.
