I made this for my Bunco group and the ladies were tipping up the punch bowl I served it in to get the last drop. Several of the ladies attending swore upon entering the house they weren't big Sangria fans---this recipe made several converts!
Awesome Awesome, Sangria Sangria!! The best, bar none!!! Make sure to do the day before (except add soda just before serving). Way better than any mexican restaurant recipe that I have had!

I made a couple changes based on what I had around the house...still came out great/my husband said I have to make a big batch for when we have our 4th of July party next weekend. I left out the triple sec (did not have nay on hand/had plenty of booze without it/never noticed it was missing) and we had powdered lemonade mix around for the kids but not lemonade concentrate...so I subsituted the powdered lemonade mix. For the soda I used Sprite.Big hit!!
This recipe is awesome! I only let it sit for 5 or 6 hours before drinking and still thought it was brilliant.

My favorite Sangria recipe. I always leave the cherries and lemonade concentrate out. I am just not a big fan of cherries and I think the lemonade makes it too sweet. I do add a little sugar, about 1/8 of a cup. I also add club soda to each glass for fizz. Love it!
I made this according to the directions with the exception of making a simple syrup for the sugar, it was heavenly... A must have for any future event!

Oh my goodness! This was soooo good! My family has been making Sangria for years...holidays and pool parties wouldn't be complete without it but THIS recipe is our favorite! Thanks for the post Hjacoby!

We loved it! We wanted to be able to eat more of the fruit so we peeled the oranges and cut them up and added additional cherries. Next time, I'll follow other reviews and add more fruits, like pineapples, etc.
Absolutely great!

Very good base recipe. Brandy and triple sec are a must.... skipped the lemonade concentrate and just added more lemon juice...Can vary the fruit- do NOT use marachino cherries (uck!). I used lemon, orange, lime and kiwi....the kiwis were delish soaked in the sangria. I also cut the sugar in half and will likely skip next time. Used an Australian Shiraz.
Amazing...coming from a long line of strong Spanish family this sangria passed the test. Made it for my Spanish family and the still talk about it. Kudos!
This is a HUGE party hit!!!!

I'm a sangria snob and loved loved loved this! I added sliced apples and I also took another reviewers suggestion and omitted the sugar and soda and added gingerale instead...but just before serving. LOVE IT!

Had some work friends over and it was a HIT! Didn't use cherries or sugar and used ginger ale instead of club soda. I had sliced the fruit into really small pieces like at my favorite sangria place but I think next time I will use larger slices.

Great sangria. Everyone loved it! Used 7up instead of sugar and carbonated water. Added it individually to each glass as I was serving. About half and half. For some reason all of my fruit tasted very bitter after it had set for 24 hours even though it was not bitter when I added it at the begining. No problem, just didn't eat the fruit. Although I am curious as to why it was bitter. Will definitley make this again and am sharing the recipe already.

Upped this recipe for 30 servings and still wasn't enough. Used 5 bottle of Jacobs Creek Shiraz. Didn't add the sugar and didn't miss it. Put it all together the night before (except for the soda, which I used Sprite and added as we drank it) and let it marinate. Used suggested fruits and added red grapes. So good! Packs a punch. Will be the standard I use from now on!

I made this for a BBQ, quadrupling the original recipe, and it was all gone before the end of the night. My guests raved about it and they all wanted the recipe. I also used ginger ale in place of the club soda and only added half the sugar. It was the best sangria I have ever had and will be making this over and over again. Thanks for sharing it!

Wonderful recipe! The entire batch was gone almost immediately. I cut down on the amount of sugar used and opted to add all of the cherry juice from the maraschino cherries for extra sweetness...yummy! I also decided to add apples as well but found that it is best to add them right before serving so that they do not soak up all of the alcohol (they were pretty potent the first time I made this recipe and allowed the apples to soak overnight). By far the BEST Sangria recipe I have come across. Thanks for sharing!!

The recipe is GOOD...but...after making it once, we altered it to include 2 more bottles of red wine, changed the triple sec to Gran Marnier and left out the sugar, opting instead for the cherry juice as the sweetner along with the Ginger Ale instead of the Soda. Awesome! Made 5 gallons and it was even better the next day!
YUM YUM YUM. Had for a birthday bbq last night and guests drank it up! (Even Grandma enjoyed!! ha!) Will keep this recipe on hand for sure! Thanks!

I second the person's opinion that this is a very forgiving recipe. I used a red zinfandel wine that I had on hand, with everything as directed except triple sec because I didn't have any. Went over well for a tapas party and complimented my theme perfectly.

CRAZY good! I've made this many times over the past year or two and anytime I bring it to a party, bbq, whatever there is never any left and I always get requests for the recipe. I use cheap red wine (usually Trader Joe's 2-buck-chuck merlot) and usually use a peach or apricot brandy, and in a pinch I've used peach schnapps in lieu of the triple sec (hey, whatever works, right?!), and aside from the listed fruit I'll also throw in oranges, frozen or fresh strawberries, basically just whatever I have on hand. It's worth the ingredients and the time it takes for the flavors to blend. Yummy-yum-yum!!!!!!
Whoa!!! This is my new summer drink... absolutely delicious! Thanks for an amazing recipe.

Great recipe! I didn't have triple sec so I added some Grand Marnier instead, I also omitted the cherries, and added a bottle of sparkling white wine instead of carbonated water or club soda, as other reviewers had suggested. Packs a strong punch, but tastes great (do be sure to let it sit before serving, though).

this was delish--and super strong! The fruit does an awesome job of hiding exactly how intense this sangria is! I added extra cherries. we also used ginger ale instead of club soda. Definitely let it all marinate over night . . . it tastes completely different (better) that way! I used cheap box red wine (which is why I made sangria in the first place). We didn't like the box wine, but it would've been alcohol abuse to throw it away, so I found this recipe to save it. It worked!!! Thanks!

This was ok. I used a port wine instead of brandy which may have caused the really strong taste. And I didn't use sugar and added sprite before serving. Everything else I did the same but it was too potent for me. Once I added the sprite it was much better but still disappointing after all the great reviews.
This was FABULOUS! I left out the sugar and added strawberries,skipped the cherries...this is going to be a regular at my house. I can't wait to make this again!!

Loved it! I followed recipe to the T except for the sugar. I dont like Too sweet drinks, and let it sit 24 hrs. After it was done marinating I tasted it and was like oh no. Citrus without enough sweet so i added some sugar and 7 Up. FABULOUS!!!! I made it for my daughters 21st birthday party and everyone loved it. I put out wine too and nobody touched it. I put a bowl of extra fruit out, strawberries, blueberries, lemons, limes and oranges for people to add as they like. My new favorite drink!

This is the first recipe that I have ever rated on AllRecipes, although I have been using the site for years! Love, LOVE this recipe. Always gets rave reviews. I did decide not to add sugar or carbonated water, but instead used lemon-lime soda. I use a 1:1 ratio. Very refreshing!
Deeeelicious! Served it to a group that included some former bartenders who have very high standards for beverages like this, and they agreed this was among the best sangria they've ever had.
Amazing. Simply the best sangria recipe.

Good recipe - only change made was to use Grand Mariner instead of the Triple Sec, as I am not a fan of triple sec. My boyfriend made this for a party and everyone loved it. The leftover fruit is addictive!
Made this for my weekend bbq and it was a huge hit. Used apples, pears, cherries and mangoes. My only grip is I didn't double the recipe. Next time I know better. Can't wait to make this again.

This is the best Sangria! Made it with Merlot, however any dry red wine will do. The brandy gives it a "kick" so it is a bit strong at first so do let it sit if you can. Have served it immedately after making it with no complaints :)
Very sweet and delicious. Made it with a cheap red wine and served it to my in-laws the last time they were over. They kept asking for more!
This was amazing!!!! I made it for a BBQ we had and the adults loved it. I even doubled the brandy, orange, juice, triple sec and lemonade mix. IT was great. This is definatley a keeper!

Love this recipe! I don't use ginger ale OR the club soda, nor the frozen lemonade, but add some of the cherry juice. I add a little extra lemon juice and half the triple sec and make a simple syrup with the sugar, as it mixes together much better. I also marinate the fruit int he punch 12-18 hours, then "muddle" to get the extra pulp and juice - discarding the rinds before they add bitterness to the sangria. I buy the Taylor Lake County red in the BIG bottle (less than $12 at Walmart) - and it is great. Be sure to drink on a full stomache, as this has quite a kick!

Awesome, if dangerous recipe. Have made it successfully many many times. 1) I recommend using orange curacao - I settle on this after experimenting with triple sec and others but invariably this provides the smoothest, richest flavor. 2) A raw cane sugar * lemon juice combo can easily be substituted for the lemonade concentrate (which is afterall just a shortcut). 3) I find a merlot is the best choice for a deeper flavor. 4) Make sure it is well chilled and all the fruit nice and alcoholic!

Delicious! I made this with some of the hints by other reviewers - no sugar or carbonated water but used gingerale instead; also, I added peaches and apples with the other fruit and left out the cherries. This was a big hit!

I have made five batches of this recipe. I use good brandy (VSOP), good OJ (not from concentrate) and good wine (the kind you would enjoy by itself). I have never added the sugar or carbonated water. This was the most popular drink at my last party (thus the five batches!) This is a keeper! P.S. This is NOT the Sangria I had in college.
Just like the sangria in Spain. I follow the recipe exactly and it's always the hit of the party.
Awesome sangria recipe!!!! I used diet gingerale instead of club soda, everyone loved it!!!!!
We loved it! Definitely will make it again. Thank you for sharing.
This is great! I didn't add any soda. Maybe someday I might try it that way. But this way is great.
This was some of the best sangria I have ever had. Served it at a Cinco de Mayo birthday celebration and everyone loved it!

Excellent! I didn't want to purchase any additional liquor for the recipe, so I went with what I happened to have on hand (mango rum and Grand Marnier instead of the brandy and triple sec - though Grand Marnier is actually a variety of triple sec liquour that is made with cognac brandy). I did not add the sugar, and used 7up instead of soda water (again, I was trying to work with what I had on had). I tasted it when I first put it together and I questioned the recipe, but after having a day to mellow out it was outstanding. I made a double batch and everyone went back for seconds (at least). This will be my go to recipe for sangria from now on.
Followed the recipe and really enjoyed this. It was in the refrigerator overnight before serving and I used a Spanish red wine-- really very nice and refreshing!

OMG-What a Fantastic Sangria. I haven't had Sangria in 10 years, but I remember loving it. I was afraid to make it for my Cinco de Mayo party (also my b-day) in such a large quantity, but it was a hit!. Made 48 servings-(ie; 4 cups brandy/triplesec equal 1/5. Cut sugar down to 1 cup; added pineapple and a can of peaches. Stored in frig overnight and bought 2 bottles of 7Up, which people could chose to add (and most did). Used a decent 5 gallon box of cab (= to 6.5 bottles) and a 1.5 liter.
OMG!!!! This came out so awesome!
good base recipe, but it left a very bitter after taste. Had to fix w/ more OJ and simple sugar. Next time will steer clear of the citrus and opt for apples and pears.
Awsome!! Make sure you double or triple this, otherwise it will be gone in an instant! Beware however, because it packs a punch!
Excellent! Used Pinot Grigio and it turned out awesome!
Finally got the chance to make this recipe over the weekend.. I used a Merlot, added the sugar and the 2 cups of GingerAle. The taste was fantastic... I will be making this again for sure..
I just made this today. SO good!
Let it sit overnight is the key! AMAZING
Very good, next time I would use less citrus & add some other fruits to it.

Honed to perfection is right! I have been drinking Sangria for at least 35 years and this is the absolute BEST I've ever had. Made it exactly according to your directions, took it to a party last night, and everyone LOVED it. Thank you!
Made this for Easter and it was a hit every with those who do not usually like wine but they loved this recipe
Did not like. Used top quality ingredients and it wasn't good. Not a good balance of ingredients, way too tart. Probably won't make again. If I do, I'll make adjustments.
I made this for a party, tripled the recipe and used the gingerale.... Everyone raved about it and several people have asked for the recipe. It was so delicious!!

I absolutely love this Sangria. I don't use the triple sec or the cherry juice but it still comes out great everytime. I have even made it without the brandy and it was still very good. Everyone raves about how great this Sangria is. I make it for almost every party I throw.
I made this recipe last summer for my boyfriend parents who are big wine drinkers. I used just a cheap bottle of red wine, peach schnapps instead of triple sec, and used mangos, oranges, and peaches.

This was wonderful! I served it for a party tonight and it was definitely a hit! EVERYONE loved it and went back for seconds-and thirds! Fantastic and tasted just like the sangria that I tried in Spain!

I made this for a party and everyone raved about it, even the ones who don't like wine. I used the sugar and ginger ale instead of soda, and it was perfectly sweet for all of us who like 'girly drinks'. Next time I will cut the orange rounds in half though, to make it easier to eat the boozed up fruit (which everyone was doing when the pitcher was gone). Definitely a keeper.
I doubled the recipe, using: Berringer's cabernet sauvignon, a total of 1/2 of sugar and no carbonated water. It was delicious!!!
Made this for the potluck dinner I had. It was really good. Next time I won't use as much lime and will put in other fruit like pineapple and cantaloupe.

I've been making this for a couple of years after having it at a friend's party...you can't beat this recipe! But I make mine with white wine (it's so good I haven't tried the red yet!), usually a cheap pinot grigio--Barefoot is great! I don't add the sugar, but do use ginger-ale instead of club soda. Like so many others have said, DEFINITELY make the night before...it needs time for the flavors to marinate. I'd give this more than 5 stars if I could!
LOVE IT!

This is a great base recipe, you can add any fruit you like and it still tatest great! I would agree with other reviews that throwing this together and letting it "marinate" overnight is key to the outcome.

So easy and really good. I made this for a party and everyone was asking me for the recipe. One thing I would do differntly next time... I would add about a cup more of wine and maybe a little less orange juice.
I would give this more starts if I could. Took it to a party and EVERYONE LOVED IT!!! Just be careful. It really is potent!!

This is delicious! I used half of a sliced orange and half the amount of club soda. Added this and let the whole thing sit overnight. It was the best I have ever had, and friends said the same thing too. Very satisfying and refreshing. Thank you.
Hit of the neighborhood!!!! It is a perfect drink for people who love wine and people who don't...it's good for all!
This was a great recipe. Did not need any sugar.

This is a favorite in our household to serve at parties. We just recently had a Poker Party and all of our guests loved it! We made several gallons of this stuff and all of our guests were pleasantly tipsy and throwing their money out the window by the end of the night:)We also used ginger ale. I got to say that it's not your traditional Sangria so if that's what you're looking for then maybe this recipe isn't the one for you. But I'm not a huge fan of red wine to begin with, so adding all the other liquors and gingerale made it a bit sweeter for me.
This is the best ever! Every time I have made it, everyone asks for the recipe! And when I make it it never last long! Thanks for sharing!

This is a staple at our parties (which my husband and I throw quite often)!! Even if it's technically 'out of season' or not really relevant to the current holiday celebration, our friends INSIST that we make this recipe! It's the best; I cannot say enough good things. The only alterations we made are to use limeade instead of lemonade and cherry brandy instead of regular...You won't be disappointed!
Loved this!!! I took this to a party and it was a huge hit! I would change anything to this recipe! Tasted very close to the one I get when we go to our favorite Italian place in Little Italy in NYC.
loved it! its a great summer day drink to sip on outside in the sun. i didnt change a thing on the recipe and it was great.
Made this for our Christmas party and it was a HUGE hit. This was the best Sangria I've ever tasted.
We omitted the lemonade concentrate, and made sure to add all the sugar called for. Wonderful!!
This is indeed the very best sangria recipe ever !!! If you prefer your wine sweet and fruity, this is a must try !! I make it at Christmas and Valentine's Day .. amazing.. thank you !! :)

I made this for a dinner party. Every one of my guests loved it - even people who normally don't drink. I omit the lime, lemon concentrate, and sugar; instead of using triple sec I used Peach Schnapps; I added a little more Brandy; added apple and pear; I also did not add carbonated water. I let it sit over night in the fridge. This is a fantastic Sangria recipe - my version is a bit strong but not too sweet. Next time I would try without adding the additional Brandy.
Fantastic sangria recipe! Made this for a Superbowl party and my guests went crazy over it. I used diet 7up as a topper instead of seltzer and it made it that much better!
This is such a great recipe! Not too sweet, and makes a great presentation in a clear pitcher. Definitely a keeper on my entertaining list.

We made this for a housewarming party to serve with margaritas and chicken fajitas. Went over very well. We made it the night before so the fruit could release all of its flavor into the liquid. I think we ended up tripling the recipe and had to make it in empty milk jugs for storage. Thanks for the recipe!

I tried this recipe. I used peach brandy and I used the triple sec. I also added 2 1/2 cups ginger ale so it wouldn't be as strong.For me it is a little to strong and the triple sec gives it a taste I don't care for to much. It is a little bitter tasting to me. But,I do need to add I have never had Sangria before, so I am not saying it is not a good recipe. I was hoping for something with a smooth fruity taste.

When you use a really good spanish wine, it can make you very tipsy! I had a cook out and made Anne's fruit salsa from this website. My friends added the fruit salsa in this sangria recipe. Very very good!
Great recipe. Added apples and ginger ale instead of club soda, kept everything else the same. Thanks!
This was awesome at Xmas time!!!

I made this last night for my book club ladies...7 outta 8 loved this drink! I used apricot brandy and peach schnapps and added strawberries…no sugar. I had club soda and ginerale on hand as mixers per the other reviews. Most went with club soda. The one gal who didn’t care for it said it was just to sweet for her…even mixing with the club soda. I can tell you I am not feeling my best today because I kept going back for more. I tripled this recipe and ran out…this is a keeper!
Left out the cherries and used peach schnapps instead of triple sec. Great recipe, but it makes a lot! If you are going to save it for a few days I suggest taking the citrus out after 24 hours.
I had to try this after reading all of the reviews and yes, it was totally 5 Star!!!
This was not what I expected, in all my years of drinking Sangria from different countries this was the worst.

One of my all-time favorite drink recipes -- have made for various occasions now and everyone has always been pleased. Never had sangria before this, but I'm sure nothing else will compare. I've tried this by the recipe, and also using the peach schnapps / rum swap - both are delicious, though I don't prefer triple sec quite as much. The first couple times I made it with Red Cat, bc that's the only type of red wine I know I like... however, after reading many reviews, I tried the cheaper red wine and it tastes just as delicious !!! No need to use the more expensive wine -- I'd save that for drinking it by itself. This sangria is fantastic.. thanks for the awesome recipe. PS -- guests love eating the cherries after they've been soaked for a day !
this recipe was soooo good. I have been searching for a sangria recipe that wasn't too tart. This was perfect!
This is a great recipe! I made it for a new years party and it was gone. I followed the recipe exactly, but I opted not to add the soda. Thanks for the recipe!!
VERY GOOD!
Excellent. I like mine a little sweeter so used 7Up instead of carbonated water. Otherwise, followed the recipe exactly.
I've tried a lot of Sangria's and this one has to many citrus ingredients. The white sugar is definately needed.
This is so tasty! Make according to recipe except add sprite and leave out the sugar.

I octupled this recipe for a birthday party and added 8 chopped granny smith apples, which I thought were pretty clutch. Mmmm...I omitted the sugar and served with ginger ale and seltzer water optional. It was a hit! Not a drop left. I also sliced half of the oranges in rounds but put in the rest in edible chunks and they were delicious. I was a little short on brandy (used a 750 mL bottle, which was a little less than a cup short of what was called for) and I doubt that it made too much of a difference. Would definitely make again!
Everyone I serve this Sangria to asks for the recipe. Absolutely fantastic! I tend to skip the concentrate since it's too sweet for my liking. Better make extras -- even the men love this one!

AWESOME! After reading reviews, I used Capt Morgan instead of Brandy and Peach Schnapps instead of triple sec, for fruit I used peaches, pears, cherries, apples & the sliced oranges and made it the day before. make a quadruple batch for our Xmas party, it was GONE! will make again and again

This recipe is fantastic! Made 2 changes.. .left out the limes (afraid it would make it too bitter) and instead of the white sugar made a simple syrup which mixes MUCH better - and no one even knows they're drinking an alcoholic beverage!! GREAT recipe! I'll use it again & again! This from someone who HATES wine!!!
The BOMB! I served this at a party and people kept asking for more... It was sooo good!!!
This is the best Sangria! I tried two batches one with brandy and the other with rum. Preferred the brandy, but both were still great!!!
Excellent! Kelcampell- I had to laugh at your review- Sangria originated in Spain- NOT Mexico! No wonder this didn't taste right to you! LOL!
Make sure you have a designated driver!
This is a great sangria recipe. I made it for a family dinner last night to serve with paella and we all loved it. We didn't have club soda so I substituted a bottle of Fresca. Worked fne.
I've made this recipe a few times now and it's ALWAYS a huge hit. I love it too!
just need to add my accolades. this is wonderful and i'm asked for the recipe EVERY TIME I make it. delicious.
Made a quadruple batch for my 40th birthday party and it was a huge hit. Every drop was consumed and I should have made more!
Pretty good sangria. Not sure if it's similar to the real thing or not but it was pretty good and I would make it again. I liked it better with some ginger ale added to it also.

I made this for a Halloween party and all my girlfriends loved it! Even the husbands enjoyed it. I made my "Witch's Brew Sangria" even more dramatic by putting my punch bowl into a bigger Halloween bucket surrounded by dry ice and water. The eerie foggy effect was perfect!

This is the best Sangria recipe. Period. I serve this at least once a month at my Yappy Hours (I own a little doggie daycare) and everyone raves about it and want the recipe! I do some modifications however. I HATE the bitterness that most sangrias have so instead of sliced citrus I use mango, pineapple, watermelon, strawberries, etc - anything but fresh sliced citrus so you don't get the bitterness of the rind.
I have made alot of Sangria. By far this has been the best recipe. I served it at a Bunko party, and everyone loved it.

oh my god this was good. it was a lot of prepwork but for a party or shower its perfect. it was a hit at my sisters bridal shower. i did make some substitutions as recommended by some of the other reviewers and i was glad i did. first of all i used cherry brandy instead of regular brandy, i wanted a little sweeter recipe. i was afraid it would be too strong. i used frozen cherries because my supermarket didnt have fresh and delish and easy! the fruit soaked up a lot of alcohol so we were sucking on the pieces long after the sangria was gone and they were heavenly. i would recommend this recipe anyday and will definitely make it again!!!!!

This is the best sangria I have ever tasted. I only added one bottle of soda water because there was no room in the large container I used - it was a multiple recipe for a big party. Every bit of it was gone at the end of the evening. Thanks!

Worth the wait! I forgot to make this the night before and started early in the morning, but this recipe definitely gets better with time! It's a lot of ingredients and could break the bank if you don't have alot of things on hand, but it well worth it!

Great recipe! I also didn't make enough and both the men and women at our BBQ enjoyed this! I also substituted the carbonated water with 7up and didn't add the sugar. Pay no mind to the reader who didn't like this because they tried "the real thing" in Mexico - someone should tell them that this is a Spanish drink!
I made this for a party. Even those who "don't like Sangria" loved it. Some preferred to add club soda instead of lemon-lime soda (which they found too sweet).

This is gooooooood....and strong! I made this for my daughters 1st birthday party. I had several people comment on how good it was and they aren't even drinkers. Definitely let it sit at least overnight! I didn't add the 7-up or club soda, but I might try that next time cause I think that would be really good too!
Perfect recipe - wouldn't change a thing.

This was delicious and easy to make. It even gets better as it sits. i didn't have regular brandy on hand, so i substituted apricot brandy. After 24 hours I removed the fruit so it wouldn't ferment or turn bitter. One week later, I had some leftover and it was even more delicious. I used Cabernet Saugvignon for the wine.
YUMMY! Made these for a Southern Living party and although I think I drank the majority everyone like them. First time making anything with pomegranite but it was easier than i thought.

HOLY MOTHER OF SILENUS! What a concoction. Fruity, flavorful and very very strong. Not that this needs any more alcohol added to it but it is also fantastic with champagne substituted for the club soda.
Ahh... sangria as it should be. I did not add the sugar, but did add about 1 cup of club soda. I also threw in an apple. Perfection in a pitcher. Yum.

Great! I think I am still hungover from this wonderful sangria we made 2 nights ago! It was perfect with the Tortilla Espanola & Paella I made. We taste tested it without Gingerale first - it was terrific, then with Gingerale and it was terrific. Fun to make, fun to drink and looks so pretty! Thanks.
Very good! My neighbor and I are scared that we are going to develop a drinking problem with this stuff!! hahaha Thanks for a great recipe!

I made this and was only able to let it set for 5 hours before serving, everyone loved it. I was glad I made a double batch. I also only had cherry flavored brandy and it worked out great. I did omit the sugar. Perfect.
Everyone loved it. Didn't add the sugar and used wild turkey instead of brandy as that is all we had...still tasted great!
everyone loved it no one tasted the alcohol at all. Used blush wine to make it sweeter.

Made this over the weekend ... it was wonderful ! Ended up drinking the whole thing with a girlfriend! I added limeade instead of lemonade just because I didn't have any. Left out the cherries too. I'm going to try and make a white sangria next.
We jazzed it up with a little more of everything, due to individual taste and then brought it to a BBQ. Everyone really enjoyed it.
This is by far the best sangria recipe I have ever tried! Everyone loves it. Great party drink.

Awesome! I took a 1.5 L bottle of Inglenook Merlot-- (cheap-- about $6.00) and I doubled the ingredients. It was wonderful. My company loved it. I didn't add limes. I let it sit in the fridge about 4 - 5 hours. Will DEFINETLEY make again!

Awesome! My husband and I made this for our family this summer and it was an instant vacation favorite. We used apricot brandy instead of regular and it turned out really well. We had to make it a second night because everyone loved it so much.

Excellent!!! I used a Peter Vella burgundy (my favorite mexican restaurant uses it in their Sangria). Also used Peach Schapps instead of triple sec. I definitely like the addition of carbonated water for a 'summer' feel. We used one with citrus flavor. Absolutely wonderful. It's almost impossible to ruin this recipe. Next time I'll try a few variation and make a 'white' Sangria. Yum!

I made this for the first time back in March for my sisters surprise b-day party. I made a double batch & it was gone before the party was over. I followed the recipe exactly as written. You can definetly add your favorite fruits for your own personal liking. I have made it several times since the party & every time its a party favorite!! Thanks for the recipe!

Great recipe! I used a package of frozen berries (strawberries, raspberries and blueberries) in addition to the citrus and cherries. I did not use any sugar. I added soda water to the glasses as it was served. It was delicious and a hit!
I've made sangria before, but this was the best. My husband absolutley loved it.
This is YUMMY!!! Be careful - it's more potent than it tastes!
I love this. So yummy! I always add raspberry club soda and never ad the sugar, instead I add 2T of grenadine.

This recipe was hands down, the best concoction I've ever brought to an event. I say this for two reasons; one, everyone at the brunch I was at commented on how great it tasted (I eased dropped of course); two, everyone was hammered but giddy! The only thing that I really did somewhat different...add strawberries with the other fruit. Also, most important of all is be sure to let the fruit marinate overnight (8hrs) and don't add any soda to it, yet). I waited until I arrived at the brunch and then added 7-up to it. This way, it had a little bubble flavor to it and the soda wasn’t flat sitting in the fridge overnight! The apricot brandy was good additive! 7 gallons of this stuff makes for some really good stories out of people you’ve never met!

I looked at a number of sangria recipes on this site before deciding on this one for serving at my niece's first birthday party. I took another reviewer's suggestion and added a bit more brandy. This was a great success! It was refreshing and the flavors of the fruit blended perfectly. I will definitely make this again!
I got the recipe from my s-i-l. Made "30 servings" for a picnic at my house. It was FANTASTIC!! Be careful, it packs quite a wallop!

This is the best sangria I have had and everyone at my last party is insisting that I make it again for my son's rehearsal dinner this weekend. So I'm preparing to make a quad-duple batch! I followed the original recipe to the "t" but I did use another's suggestion of ginger ale instead of the sugar. Fabulous!

This recipe is amazing! Honestly, I've never had any other sangria before, but everyone I served it to (3 different times) said it was fantastic. I took the advice of another reviewer and used peach schnapps instead of triple sec. I didn't use any cherries, but instead added blueberries, kiwis, and pineapples. However, the pineapples were a bit iffy. I guess they have some kind of special digestive enzyme in them and so they will do weird things to the sangria if you use a lot or if you add the juice as well. I did both of these things once but it still tasted fine, just smelled a little ripe. I made sure it was consumed the very next day. Also, I think the cabonated water or 7-up really ruins this drink. Try it without or let people choose if they want to add it or not.
This Sangria recipe received rave reviews at my last party!
So very, very, very Fab!!

Made this Sangria for our July Sangria & Summer Wine Party. Friends helped me taste test the week before!I made several batches to the T but without the sodas. I used different reds (Malbec, Merlot, & a Cabernet) did use the cherries & some juice along with a partially ripened peach. OMG we let it sit in Fridge for 48 hrs. and what a difference 1 more day can make. We did really like the Malbec Sangria it had a different flavor.
best recipe ever! ive tried different resaurant sangria and now i wont drink anything but this!!!!

I agree with everyone else! This is a great idiot proof recipe. I made it with cheap red wine and it was delicious. As many others did before me, I omitted the sugar and used ginger ale. I made a double batch. It looked great in my punch bowl. This recipe is a keeper for sure!
I made this for a dinner party and it was a huge hit. I did not add the sugar...I think it would have been too sweet. Very easy and very worthwhile.
I made with fresh speamint and it was awefull. Make sure you use Peppermint.

Great Sangria!!! Have made this several times and everyone likes it. I usually use one bottle of "Sangria" wine and another bottle of whatever red/apple I have on hand. Doesn't really matter. It's the other ingredients that make this Sangria special!! Great in the frig for a few days.

This is a great item to keep in the fridge during the summer in case company comes by or just when the mood strikes. It is good to make in the morning for a dinner cook out. Also, I do not bother with the fruit since it takes up room in the glass. Just pour it over ice and yum, yum. Be careful! It has a punch and goes down really easy!!!
Yummy
This is great sangria! I took some of the other members advice and used sprite, but I loved it and plan on serving it often!

Turned out perfect. I will definitely continue to make this. I make it with the sugar and I leave a bottle of tonic water nearby for anyone that wants to lighten up their drink a bit or create a more fizzy drink.
I actually only used half a can of pink lemonade and just the fruit, with one more orange in it. Turned out very very sweet and citrus-y and kept for days.
This is the best! Love It! Followed recipe to the tee!
Fantastic as it is! You can't just have one glass.
Fantastic!!!! Made this for a summer luncheon and my friends loved it! It is so easy to make. You must let it sit over night for it to bring out all of the flavors.

This is an excellent drink. I had never made Sangria before but was suprised how easy it was to make. I have made this several times now because I keep getting asked to bring it to parties. I omitted the sugar and just used key lime flavored carbonated water to each glass I served and I omitted the cherries and added some sliced apples. Thanks for a great recipe

This Sangria is truly the best...I have made and tried several, and this is the one I always come back to...to the person who said this was the nastiest recipe they have ever had...I too have been to Mexico, and you have no idea what you are talking about...Kudos! this IS the best!

This is a VERY tasty Sangria. I am NOT a red wine fan, but I really enjoyed this mixture very much. I left out the marachino cherries (don't like cherries), but followed the rest of the recipe verbatim. My company raved about it and I enjoyed it, too! Definitely a keeper recipe and will make it again.

This recipe is delicious. The market did not have lemonade concentrate, so I went with limeade concentrate instead. I also used Burgandy wine in those big jugs. Oh and I added a splash of Rose's Lime Juice, too.

This was fantastic. I did make the night before. I did not add the sugar as it was sweet enough. I also did not add the club soda or Sprite to the entire batch. Rather, I mixed in individual glasses. Therefore, if people wanted it sweeter I mixed w/Sprite...if not I mixed with club soda. This was a big hit at my 4th of July party...doubling the recipe makes a gallon...I made 3!

I followed one of the readers suggestion to substitute Captain Morgans and Peach Schnapps for the triple sec and brandy and have handed this recipe out countless times. You can add gingerale before serving if you don't want it so strong.

I have made this for cookouts for the last year, and it is by far the best Sangria! I don't change a thing except quadruple the recipe, and it's gone in no time. Definitely needs to sit overnight. I serve mine over crushed ice. Also, I use the big jug 'o wine, even though I would never drink that stuff alone, it doesn't matter in this recipe because there are so many other ingredients. Wonderful recipe!
Great mix! Pretty and tasty!
I added sliced green apple and used 1/2 cup simple syrup instead of the sugar. Wonderful! Everyone loves the recipe so be sure to double it.
Delicious! I doubled the brandy & this was a huge hit among my girlfriends -- 2 of whom had lived in Spain for a year+. They said it was the best!

I followed this almost exactly, but I changed the fruit up a bit. I used some fresh peaches and I cut down a bit on the limes and lemon. I also cut the sugar in half...not as necessary with the sweeter fruit. I served this party and it was gone in a flash...DELICIOUS!

This is the best sangria recipe yet! It is comparable to the one at my favorite Portuguese restaurant. As other reviewers suggested, I used Sprite (instead of sugar and carbonated water) to sweeten. I also used some of the maraschino cherry juice to sweeten it, as well. I didn't have oranges, but I cut up some strawberries to add. You can easily drink a lot of this because it does not have a strong alcohol taste. Be careful not to drink too much; the next day is a bit rough. :)
I have made this twice recently for parties. Everyone loved it. Thanks for a great recipe.
awesome!

Great Sangria recipe! I used ginger ale instead of sugar and carbonated water as suggested. It was better after sitting overnight. We did serve some right when we made our double batch and it was still good!
I followed all the directions and ended up with Sangria with a kick. I made a double batch, everyone enjoyed it.

Followed the recipe exactly, except for the optional items. Did not need the sugar or carbonated water. Let the mix(without the wine) sit in the fridge over night, it was fantastic. My new summer drink. I will make this over and over.

I had to try this recipe with all of the rave reviews, and wow were they right. I have since made this Sangria with both red and white wines(with white I use apples to soak up the flavors). Both types have been devoured. I never use the optional sugar or club soda, but sometimes I use pink lemonade instead of regular and it tastes just as good (It dilutes the color of the white wine though). YUMMMY!!

I made this in a double batch, using a liter of Montepulciano D'Abruzzo, which I know is Italian,not Spainish, but what the heck. I used peach schnapps instead of triple sec, and instead of the traditional citrus, which makes it bitter if you leave it in too long, I drained a can of Dole tropical fruit, pureed it, then added it to the sangria, I also added about half of the juice. I sweetened with about 2 T sugar, and 1/4 c maraschino cherry juice, since the cherries just sink to the bottom anyway. I added the club soda to the glasses as we drank it...AWESOME!!
One word....deliciuos!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I used Spanish wine, like another reviewer did, spiced rum and 7-up. It was the best! My mom and sister loved it too. Thanks to the reviews I was able to put my own twist on this recipe.

I loved this sangria! It was my first time & I thought it tasted as good as any restaurant's. I followed the recipe closely except for the following: I used a sweet red wine & so I didn't use any additional sugar, I added pears to the fruits & I didn't use the cherries. Delicious! Will definitely make again.

YUMMY! Made it last weekend as an adult alternative beverage at my son's 14th b-day party and it was delicious! Used Cap't Morgan's pineapple rum, cheap grocery store merlot and pineapple/orange juice instead of plain OJ. For fruit used: oranges, limes, lemons, strawberries and cherries. Soaked fruit overnight in the rum and sugar and added the wine and OJ a couple of hours prior to serving. Definitely a keeper. I started another batch of fruit soaking but didn't need it so I put it in a large ziploc bag and tossed it in the freezer to thaw and make another day. I plan on using it this weekend!
Excellent! Didn't change a thing and this will be my forever Sangria recipe.

Delicious and Strong!! I used a wine "cube" of Cabernet/Shiraz. A friend of mine said a restaurant she used to work for used cabernet and it worked out great! I followed the recipe fairly accurately except I didn't have any o.j. so I left it out and I only added a teaspoon of sugar per batch. I didn't want it too sweet... Also as the carbonated water was optional, I had sprite out as a mixer and people could add however much they wanted for the desired strength. Everyone loved it. I suggest making a double batch:)

I just made this for a party over the weekend. It was very easy to make, and everyone loved it. I started with a double batch and ended up having to make another batch during the party because it went so quickly. I followed the suggestion of others and omitted the sugar and used diet Sprite instead of club soda.

This was very good! My guests really liked it and it was easy to put together. I made it only hours before my party and it was still good. Definitely would be better the next day though. I'll keep this one on hand for our next "happy hour". Thanks!
WOW!!!! This was the best sangria I have ever made. I cut the rum down and added ginger ale to the glasses befor I pured the punch in. Wonderful summertime drink. This is a keeper!!
Made it for a party, everyone loved it!

I made both this recipe and "Conchi's Sangria" and did a blind taste-test with all my sangria-loving pals at our cottage. This one WON by a 8-1 vote! Skipped the cherries and added some granny smith apples which were fun to eat after soaking in the wine (and added to the buzz!)

Yummmmy!!! Wow, what can I say! The best sangria I have ever had. I made one batch for a bbq, which disappeared in no time... (should have doubled it) I didn't add the cherries or the sugar, used diet sprite instead of the carb water and it was perfect. This one is a keeper. Thank you for sharing this awesome recipe.

We made three batches of this sangria for our Memorial Day party, and it was the favorite drink. The only change we made was to use diet Sprite instead of carbonated water. Otherwise, everything was the same - to the measurement in the recipe. This is a perfect summer drink!

I believe I may have developed a bit of a drinking problem because of this recipe...lol! You can use inexpensive wine, make sure it's dry. I tried using a cheap box of wine so that I could prepare it for the masses, and it was gross. Something about box wine being sweet, yuck. Do not change a thing and you will have the best Sangria ever!!!
I liked this sangria, but I like the recipe that I normally use better. There was a lot of this left over at my party which is NOT normal for sangria! LOL

Lieke other reviewers, I used Taylor Lake Country Red, econo-jug-inexpensive wine. I used rum instead of brandy, because I didn't have any brandy. Otherwise, followed the ingredients. Didn't water down with anything carbonated. The Bunco-babes and I loved it, especially after three glasses each. It will definitely creep up on you. Warning to peri-menopausal women: may lead to hot flashes.
I made this with Louis Jadot Beaujolais Red Burgundy...it was outstanding. One of the best Sangrias I ever tasted! My guests agreed!!!
Perfect for a hot day!

Sorry folks, guess you haven't had my friend Helen's Sangria! She won't share her recipe and I thought this might be it. I followed the suggestions of eliminating the sugar and using Ginger Ale as a carbonator, added gingerale to the glass at the end, didn't work. Added the 1/4 c. of sugar and it didn't help much so when the brige group arrived, I dumped the 2 cups of Ginger Ale in the pitcher with the mix. There were no 2nds asked. Didn't expect any to be leftover but it is 'marinating' in the refrigerator and I will probably throw it out. Oh, I did use a good wine that I would drink. Too sour, even with sugar, and too lemony and fruit didn't look pretty, like Helen's.

Woweee! This is a tasty drink. And it was fun to make. I did cut back on the sugar a bit, but otherwise made exactly as the recipe states. I will have a pitcher of this on hand whenever friends visit. Thanks for the recipe!
Wow...what a great summer treat. I used apricot brandy and sprite instead of sugar. Yummy!!!

I drank the entire pitcher & now I don't remember if it was good or not. Maybe I should try it again? Just kidding. It was excellent. I wish I had omitted the sugar like others suggested though. The first glass was a little too sweet for my liking - after the first glass though, I didn't notice it as much.

WOW - this is AWESOME!!! The only thing I did differently was to marinate everything but the red wine and sparkling water first - for about 2 hours, then I added the red wine (a Spanish Rioja) and let it chill for another 2 hours. I can't even imagine how much better it could be if I'd started the night before!! I didn't add the sparkling water - it would be a good way to stretch it and tame it down, but I didn't need to do either. Thanks for this recipe!! I was a very happy mother on mothers day (grin)
Very, very good, rave reviews from party goers. Added ginger ale with every glass. A great way to use some inexpensive merlot!

Fabulous! My husband and I had another couple over for a Mexican dinner. We served this Sangria. (The first Sangria I've ever made.) The guys had beer because "Sangria is girl's stuff." However, after one sample sip, both of them switched from their beer to our girly Sangria! :) Unfortunately, after that, I wish we had made more than one batch!

This drink would cost a small fortune if I had to buy brandy, triple sec, etc. I have had Sangria in Spain and I can tell you it was absolutely delish without all the added liqeurs. Liquor may be quicker but simpler is better.
This is my "go-to" sangria recipe. I don't add sugar or seltzer water. Caution: this is a strong drink. Sip it slowly over ice and enjoy eating the alcohol-infused fruit. You won't be disappointed!
I made this for an anniversary party and everybody loved it. The only changes I made were I didn't have any brandy so I used rum and I threw in the juice from the cherries. Very good recipe!

We made a double batch for our party and wished we had made even more. It went in a flash! We added pineapple chunks, pineapple juice, a splash of cherry juice, and some cherry brandy. An awesome drink! Thanks!!
I made this for a party and everyone loved it.

Wow! This is absolutely the best drink that I have had in a long time!!! The taste, the presentation, EVERYTHING!!! I thought it would be a little sweet for my taste because I'm more of a dry red kinda girl....but wow....I love it!!! Kudos!!!

A very forgiving recipe! We made this last night for a party, and everyone enjoyed it. (We made it last for an Easter gathering, with boisterous reviews.) Last night, one person switched from white wine to the Sangria and never went back! We made three changes because we think we are "Sangria Aficianados." We omitted the cherries and carbonated water, and added 1/2 cup Peach Schnapps, and substituted diet 7-Up for the water. Aside from the basic bones of this recipe (the wine, oranges, lemons, limes and specified liqours), many variation work. Apples and Pears work. We always add Brandy and Triple Sec and use 7-Up, but if something is not around or we run out, we find substitutes. I have friends who add dry fruit to their Sangria. (I think it is sweeter, but tasty. They used dried mango and pineapple.) This is really a great ice breaker at a party of friends or acquaintances.

WOW! I made this for a barbeque two days ago and its already known as the "infamous sangria." I can see this getting made for years to come. I left out the sugar and used all the juice from the jar of maraschino cherries. Be warned: this will sneak up on you!

I made this for our open house it was a complete hit! I ended up having to make more and everyone kept asking for the recipe. I served it with a creme cheese with the pepper onion relish from Harry and David which was a hit too :)

I, luckily, added the carbonated water to a glass instead of the pitcher. I really didn't like it, so I would recommend trying that first. I also found this to be very strong (maybe because I left out the water? so adding more juice or something to compensate might be a good idea).
The best! I used peach schnapps instead of triple sec. I made 4 batches of it for a party and it was gone at the end of the night!

Being clueless about red wine (I drink white) I bought the cheapest I could find (Gallo Cabernet Savignon). I also had to improvise because I realized I didn't have the brandy OR the triple sec I though I had. SO, instead I used burbon and orange flavored tequila that I had on hand. Instead of the sugar I used sweet & low and added extra as I like my sangria just a little bit sweeter. I marinated overnight (including the cherries) and it was the single best sangria I'd ever had. I did NOT add the carbonated soda as it was perfect without. I took the rest over to my dad, the sangria affectionado and he also proclaimed it the best ever....and we fought over the 'marinated' cherries. If I can make it with tequila and burbon and still have it be phenomenal, how would it be if I followed with brandy and triple sec???? I need to find out! I removed the fruit on my second batch--after leaving the citrus slices in for 48 hours my first batch started turning bitter. This is definitely the new party drink at our house!
This is DELICIOUS! I have made it twice more since I introduced my friends to this recipe. Yum!
This recipe was great! I combined some other ingredients from another recipe & everyone loved it. It's definitely on my menu for the summer barbeque.
very good! I only gave it 4 stars because it's a little too sweet for me, so I just cut back on lemonade concentrate and sugar. Much like the restaurants!
took this to a party, it was a huge hit. Everyone loved it and wanted the recipe.
this recipe is fantastic! I used a sweet red wine, peach brandy, peach slices, pineapple slices, pear slices, and I added a cup of lemon-lime club soda just before serving. Everyone loved it!
This was great! I used Robert Mondavi Merlot for the dry red and everyone loved it. If you want a party hit - definitely make this one - best sangria I've had.
I made this at my New Year's Eve Eve party and the guests loved it. Used 7-up instead of carbonated water and let it rest in the refrigerator overnight.

Love this! Made it for a get together and even one of my fiance's buds snuck one in between his beers. Topped it off with a little 7Up instead of the sugar. Also used fresh cherries since I had them. Would definitely make again.
Oh my, this was good. I had some leftover and did not want to pour it down the drain. So I got out my trusty freezer containers and froze it. Talk about a yummy icee.

I made 4 pitchers of this for christmas and it was a hit. I omitted the sugar. I added juices from pineapple chunks, cherry juice, I added oranges, limes and lemons. I used the triple sec and added ginger ale. It was great 2 and 3 days later. Made it again for New Years. the liquor store recommended Taylor Lake Country Red in a giant Jug and cheap. It worked really really well. will make this again and again.

Made this for a party in a pinch, with only 3 1/2 hours for it to sit, and it was still delicious. Was a better flavor the next day, but for all those who don't have enough time, I say go for it. Left out the sugar and just used ginger ale like others here, found it to be easier and it was just the right sweetness. Also, swapped frozen berries and pineapple for the cherries (which I don't care for) and thought that was a good change.

AMAZING! I love sangria, so there was no doubt I would enjoy this. I was so excited when my guests adored it too. The men were too "manly" to try it, but 3 girls (including myself) downed 2 batches. I will definitely be making this again.
This was very good, but kind of strong. I used 7up with it.

I made this on two separate occassions over the summer and everyone loved it. I omitted the soft drink, it's a lot stronger without it. I also added apples to the mix. Update: I made this with Gallo Hearty Burgundy wine and because it's naturally sweet, sugar isn't necessary.

I am used to making Sangria with a Monin mix, which is hard to find other than ordering it online. So, i thought I'd give this a try last night for New Year's Eve. I made a triple batch, it was all gone. I have a new favorite! And without the pricey Monin mix! I, too, use Charles Shaw (Two Buck Chuck) wines. They're our favorite and you can't beat the price!

Very tasty and a hit at the party! I substituted Citron Rum for the brandy, used triple sec, eliminated the sugar and used 7-Up instead of club soda. I do recommend having some of the soda available for your drinkers to mellow the sangria if needed. For reference, I used "2 buck Chuck" Merlot from Trader Joe's. I made a double batch and used 2 oranges, 2 limes and 2 lemons per the recipe. Next time, I'll use one of each for a double batch just to save space in the pitcher and glasses. Also, I recommend halving the orange slices so they fit in the glass better. Will definitely make again! Thanks!

Excellent recipe, just a few modifications. Used spiced dark rum instead of brandy, a little sugar, no triple sec, more cherries and fruit, and no carbonated beverages. A nice smooth sangria everyone loved!

Wow, really good. Very easy, never made it before, did use suggestions re: light rum, used Trader Joe's 2.99 Shiraz etc. added sprite zero just before serving. Made a double batch and it was gone quick!

Oh my flippin' heck! This is awesome. I never thought I liked Sangria...but then a friend made some that changed my mind. I don't have her recipe so I tried this one. My hubby doesn't like red wine and loves this too! I didn't have lemonade when I first made it - used lemon juice. Also, I had orange and grapefruit juice to use up - yum. Could really play with the fruit juice. And I like this sagria both with and without the soda water (or ginger ale). Enjoy!
I love sangria and this recipe works!

Exquisite recipe! I skipped on sugar, triple sec, but added a pear, apple, mango/peach margarita mix, and gingerale. “Cooked” in the fridge over for about 18 hrs. Will be making it again for the next gathering.
EXCELLENT RECIPE! I get sooo many kudos everytime I make this Sangria. I only wish it was my creation!
This is the best sangria I have ever had. I did not use the carbonated water but did add 2 cans of gingerale and most definitely needs to sit at least overnight. Thanks for this definite keeper.

FABULOUS!!! Served it at my daughter's wedding and it disappeared in a flash and everyone raved about it. I made some substitutions/changes: NO maraschino cherries or sugar water. I used lime flavored tonic water instead of 7-up or gingerale. The key to this is the wine...the Rioja was fabulous. I think marinating it with the fruit 24 hrs. in advance is also key. I only used oranges, lemons and limes. Can't wait to make it again.
I made about 30 servings of this recipe for a tapas party and it was long gone early in the night. Definitely a hit!

Excellent recipe! My guests were thanking me while drinking up the two batches I made. I used rum instead of brandy and sprite (omitted the sugar) instead of carbonated water. Also, I bought Trader Joe's Merlot wine ($1.99 a bottle!) I made the evening before my gathering and placed in a punch bowl. It made a very nice centerpiece with the fruit (apples/pears/orange slices) in it. I will definitely make again for the Holidays.

This is an OUTSTANDING Sangria! It has a major kick so make sure when you make it, your guests have plenty of time to sober up! I like a little sweeter sangria so I ommited the cherries and put in sliced nectarines and served with ginger ale. A do listen to the other reviews about making double batches...one isn't enough!

This is the best Sangria ever! I've made this several times already. The only changes I make are to leave out the sugar and cherries (don't like 'em), then serve mixed with ginger ale. Beware - make 2x what you THINK you need because this goes fast!! Thanks for the recipe.

Excellent! I left out the lemonade, sugar and cherries and substituted lemon/lime soda for carbonated water and it was fantastic- I needed to change the quantity to serve 50 people. I bought several gallons (4 liters each)el cheapo red wine and adjusted the remaining ingredients to make several batches. I don't even like red wine by itself but this was muey fantastico!!

I have never made a Sangria before. This was the first time having one and it was lovely. I did add some ginger ale to my glass just to calm the strong taste a little. I used Rosemount Shiraz wine. I also used apricot brandy and a little rum added as well. It marinated in the fridge for a day. My boyfriend didnt care for it so I had to drink it all by myself. It would be a great summer drink to take to cookouts!
great sangria recipe!
WONDERFUL!!!

I used this recipe to make sangria for the first time. It was sooooooo good. As some reviewers suggested, I omitted the sugar and used ginger ale in place of the carbonated water. I also added apples, peaches and plums. I made a pretty big batch and am happy to say it disappeared. Yummy!

I made this for my boyfriend's birthday party, and it was fantastic!!! I used four bottles of wine to make two 1-gallon pitchers. I used rum instead of brandy and peach schnapps instead of triple sec. In addition to the lemons, limes, oranges, and cherries, I also added pineapple chunks. I omitted the lemonade concentrate and sugar, but added some of the cherry juice. I let it sit overnight. Also, I did not add carbonated water or soda to the Sangria, but had it on hand. When serving, I mixed half gingerale with half Sangria in the glass for most people, but some of our more seasoned drinkers preferred it by itself or mixed with Red Bull. The pineapple did NOT taste good when eaten, so I won't add it next time, but the oranges and cherries were to die for! Great recipe!
I made this for a summer party and it was a huge hit. I will definitely be making this again.

This is the best sangria recipe ever.I won't be using any other recipe from now on. I omitted sugar and water. Refrigerate it over night for best results. I used a inexpensive red spanish wine called El Paseo. Yummy!
This is an excellent recipe. I used sprite instead because that's what I had on hand, everything else is as indicated in the original recipe. This will be my entertaining beverage from now on.

I made this to serve 50 at my housewarming pool party. Instead of the recommended amt of brandy, I did half brandy and half peach schnapps. Also, instead of sugar, I added a big jar of maraschinos with the juice, plus the recommended amt of soda (I used Sprite Zero.) If I did it again I would only slice up one each of the citrus fruits-- I sliced about 4 of each and even that was too much perhaps because I served it in a beverage jar with a spigot at the bottom, instead of a punch bowl or pitcher, so people didn't have access to the fruit. I had about 40 people at the party and the sangria was a big hit. Thanks for the recipe and for all the suggestions! Will definitely make again!
Fabulous. I only let it sit in the fridge for 5 hours and it was still wonderful. I added 1 cup ginger ale 1 cup club soda right before serving.

Sept 15 2007 - I Tried this for the first time for a birthday party cook-out..Im not a drinker but this is so good i had 3 small cups of it.Sub barcardi lite rum for brandy & used peach snapps for triple sec.Instead of dry red wine used Arbor Mist Sangria Zinfandel.Forgot to add 7-up,still tasted great.Everybody loved it including the guys.Mother-in law not a drinker & she like it too.
This is one of the most requested recipes I have ever made--I made it last spring for a luncheon and am still getting requests for the recipe. Bravo!
Made this the other night and my guests loved it! I put Gran Marnier in it and it was the best.
This Sangria is awesome! I didn't have any lemonaide concentrate so I used that same amount of lemon concentrate and added some sugar. It's a huge hit everytime I serve it. :)

I really enjoy making this recipe and my friends love drinking it. It seems like I never make enough. It is easy to improvise and add your own touches with this recipe. I make it a little differently every time and it always comes out great.

FANTABULOSO!! I did make a few changes, mostly because I didn't have a few exact ingredients. Instead of 1/2 cup brandy I used 1/4 spiced rum with 1/4 brandy. I used Cointreau for the triple sec because I'm a snob and prefer it. Didn't have frozen lemonade, but did have pineapple sherbet, used two scoops. No cherries, so I splashed in some grenadine. My only mistake was that I didn't DOUBLE it for four people. Oh and I added an extra peach. The fruit was yummy over frozen custard later. burp
I made it for a party and everyone loved it (atleast that's what they said). I didn't like the carbonation... thus 4 stars. I didn't add the sugar.

A must for any BBQ! This is the best Sangria! I substituted the brandy for rum and used gingerale instead of the sugar and club soda. I used a very inexpensive bottle of burgandy wine (as suggested by the liquor store employee).
Made a triple batch for a picnic and all was gone in an hour!!!!!!! Great recipe!!!!

I made this to serve as a pre drink for my daughters 21 birthday. I excluded the brandy, and used gingerale .. for triple sec we used grand marniar. everything else was accurate.. it was awesome. everyone loved it and it went well with the fish tacos. I will definately make this again. Cheers!!
Very good! This reminded me of grapefruit juice which I found shocking considering the amount of alcohol it contained! This is the only recipe I've ever attempted...
Fantastic Recipe. Best Sangria I have had in the states... Party guests raved about it
Very Good! Will definately make it again for another party!
yum - lots of ingredients though

I took this to a party. It wasn't a big hit with the women, but one guy drank a ton of it because he wasn't getting buzzed off his wine coolers. I thought it was okay, but wouldn't spend the money to make it again.
Wow! This packs a punch!! I will make it again, but add less brandy, or maybe use a flavored brandy, like peach. Adding the ginger ale is absolutely necessary to dilute it.

This sangria is DELICIOUS! I made it without the extra sugar and used some canned peaches/nectarines and their juice. I only let it sit for about an hour and it was still fantastic. Topped off with ginger ale, it's marvelous! It certainly does sneak up on you...but very pleasantly :) Thanks for the great recipe!
Awesome.....knock you off your feet....but really yummy too!!!

This was delecious!!! Instead of buying triple sec, the liquor store sold brandy and orange together, it was very yummy! Also, instead of adding sugar I bought a sweeter wine that was recommended by the sales rep. Otherwise followed the recipe the same and everyone loved it!
Yowza! Very very strong if you don't dilute it, and my guests didn't realize that! Next time, will add the lemonade (or ginger ale or whatever) prior to serving for the sake of my guests!

I have never made Sangria and with all of the recipes out there I had a hard time choosing which one to make. My best friend suggested this one. I did not ad any sugar, but did add fresh nectarines in with the fruit. All I can say is watch out...this stuff has one heck of kick.

I left out the cherries and sugar and added a peach. I used 2-Buck-Chuck cabernet sauvignon, which worked just fine. I made 4 batches and let them sit overnight -- this was a HUGE hit at my housewarming party. We ran out in about an hour, and everyone was digging the fruit out of the pitchers. Next time I will add pineapple and maybe other fruits.... great recipe!!
Awesome.

Oh my goodness! This is to die for! I made it for a backyard BBQ. My only mistake was making only a double batch! I was shocked to discover that the men would pass on beer for some sangria! Just a tip, it must sit overnight or longer! Also, don't mix the sprite or soda water. It doesn't need it.

EXCELLENT!!! I did not have any Frozen lemonade, so I substituted My kids' lemonade mix for that and the sugar, it turned out perfect! Keeps for days and everyone loved it!Try mixing half and half with a white sangria recipe, very refreshing!
I made these for a small gathering of friends and it was a huge hit.Everyone was looking for more when it was all gone.Definitely a permanent recipe.
This is a delicious sangria. We used Sprite to make it a little sweeter. 2.5 gallons of this were gone in a couple hours.
I have used this recipe several times now. Everyone raves about it! Thanks!

I really like sangria and this was an awesome recipe. My only advice is make A LOT becuase it goes quick! I took another reviewer's advice and used giner ale instead of club soda and it was very good! I tripled the recipe and still needed to make more!!! I will definately be making this recipe again! Thanks for sharing it!!!
Very tasty! A big hit at a casual party at home.

Whoa! This was delicious - I used spiced rum vs. brandy, blackberry merlot and omitted the sugar. Even my beer drinking husband enjoyed this cocktail! The secret is definitely letting it sit overnight. Very tasty with a great kick :-)
I had a girlie party and I made this drink and it was a hit. All the ladies loved it and wanted the recipe!

Made this for a dinner party last night w/ a cuban menu...it was WONDERFUL sangria!! I doubled the recipe. The only thing I did a little different was to use Splenda & pineapple juice in place of the sugar. I will definitely be making this again & again! Enjoy:)

WOW - Superb! Served this tonight for a Cuban-themed dinner for six friends and the two batches weren't quite enough, so we hit a bottle of red wine after we ran out of the Sangria! I loved the brandy and triple sec and don't think I'd substitute those. I omitted the sugar and added Diet 7-UP instead of carbonated water. Even the red-wine hater asked for more!! The best new recipe I've gotten in awhile - thanks!!

I've been making this Sangria recipe for three years now. I make it ahead of time and share it with friends on our summer camping trips. I've tried other Sangria recipes, and ordered Sangria in restaurants and this is BY FAR the best ever! For my taste, the fruit & juice add enough sweetness, so I omit the sugar altogether.

We made this for friends last weekend and it was a HUGE hit. The only issue is that we didn't make enough! We really don't know much about sangria so we were flying blind here, but boy will this become a staple for us from now on. Thanks for the recipe!
I substituted rum for the brandy and added diced apples. Yum!
Great Recipe!!! Everyone loved it!

I have been making this for summer parties for the last two years and it is always a hit. EVERYONE loves it. The 1st time they drink they always try to figure out all the wonderful tastes. I use inexpensive red wine by the gallon and it is just as great. Hint, dont put the fruit in a skinny neck bottle!!!

Wow! This IS the best Sangria recipe! I typically can "take-or-leave" Sangria, but decided to try it out on company this week. I wouldn't change a thing on the recipe - I did add club soda to the mix, otherwise it may have been too sweet. Very YUMMMMMMY!
Just one word.....delicious!!!! The best sangria I've ever had.
Very delicious! Used good brandy & Cointreau to dress it up. I'll definitely make this again to accompany my favorite Mexican dishes - especially the spicy ones!
The only ingriendent that was different was the brandy, mine was apricot brandy. I doubled the recipe an it was gone for the Father's Day BBQ! This recipe is a keeper!
I thought this was good, but not as amazing as the other reviews. Oh well.

Double batch was all gone! Left out the sugar and used ginger ale. Big hit. Only refrigerated for about 5 hours, and was still really good. Will definitely plan ahead next time, as I am sure that it's even better after sitting overnight.
Incredible! I followed another reviewers lead and substituted Rum and Peach Schnapps. Absolutely love this recipe!

I'm thrilled to have found this recipe. We have about 50 bottles of yucky homemade red wine that no one will drink. I used it with this recipe and it's fantastic! Definitely try to make ahead. I also skipped the carbonated water and sugar, and just gave my guests the options to add some sprite to their glass if they wish. A huge hit, will make a lot this summer..thanks!

A fantastic recipe - it was gone at no time in my party. I originally tripled the recipe, but still had to make another triple batch in the middle of the party because it was gone in under 30 minutes. I didn't use the carbonated water, and let it sit overnight - delicious!

Absolutely delicious--I can't stop making it! This is also a fun recipe to play with. I tend to overbuy when it comes to fruit, so I throw in whatever I need to use up--sliced strawberries and kiwi are my favorite additions. However tempting it is to start pouring early, you're cheating yourself if you don't wait at least 24 hours. If you can hold out for 36, even better. This stuff gets better the longer it sits in the fridge.

Awesome! Made this last night for a cookout at our house and it was a hit - not a drop left! I doubled the recipe and omitted the sugar. I had cans of sprite zero sitting next to the pitcher sangria for guests to add if they desired. Without the sprite it was very strong . I added sprite to mine and it was perfect.

Incredibly good! I went to 2 stores and couldn't find triple sec so I just left it out. The only other thing I changed was another reviewers suggestion to add gingerale instead of carbonated water. I served this at a ladies' night and it was a big hit! There are already requests for upcoming summer parties! Just be careful because it definitely packs a punch!!
This recipe for sangria was excellent! I used champagne instead of club soda to add fizz and a little extra kick! Got rave reviews from my guests!

I will admit that when I first made this recipe and took a sip I wasn't sure I would like it, but letting it sit for approximately 24 hours made all the difference in the world. The flavors from the sliced fruits really come out after the Sangria sits overnight. I doubled the recipe and it nearly made two quarts. I am not a maraschino cherry fan so I left those out. If you would like, you could add a little club soda to your glass to tone it down for those who cannot handle the stronger flavors of the alcohol. My husband liked this and thinks I should make it again. I concur! Great drink for warmer weather!
Really great! I left off adding the sugar and used 7-up to add to the mix before serving.

I made two batches - one with club soda and one without. I think that I liked it better with the club soda. I think it could have used more brandy, and I was glad that I didn't add the sugar! It was really good!
I loved this. It definitely had a lot of brandy and packed a punch.

This recipe is PERFECT. I've made this sangria several times and given the recipe away each time. The alcohol content is just right for a relaxing evening on the deck or your celebration of choice. I've also served the soaked fruit separately and that was a hit too. I definitely recommend this.
i agree that there is no reason to try another recipe after you've had THIS one! requested every year for cinco de mayo!

This was amazing sangria! The BEST I've ever had, let alone made myself. I made twice as much but substituted brandy with rum and used gingerale. I took it to a BBQ and we couldn't stop talking about it! I've passed this recipe on to everyone who was there.

I made this sangria for a fiesta party and within 30 minutes it was nearly gone (and I even doubled the recipe!) It was a hit and I'll make it again! I used peach scnapps and rum rather than brandy and triple sec. I also used a liter of ginger ale and fresh peach slices just moments before serving. Fantastico!!
This was pretty darn good, I let it sit in the fridge for 2 days and added a can of sprite right before drinking. I'm adding apples to it this time. Thanks
It was just ok for me. My friends enjoyed it. I will make it again. Next time I will put less alcohol in it. Was too strong for me.

This was delicious. I used peaches instead of cherries. Also, I used a pineapple Mexican soda that I found in individual bottles in the Mexican aisle of the grocery store in lieu of the optional carbonated beverage. It really came out fantastic.
Great sangria recipe. I have made it several times, following the recipe exactly. Friends love it!

I made this in the summer for a gathering, and I have been getting requests for it ever since! It's so good, it is smooth, you don't taste much alcohol but it can knock you on your but easily! I used 7-up instead of ginger ale, I mean lemons and limes are added so why not a soda with a lemon lime flavor? It is a must try, and save recipe, cause once you make it, people just won't let you stop.
this was easy and delicious. my first time making it!
this was easy and delicious. my first time making it!
Big hit at New Years! Dont change a thing! perfect as it is.

Excellent! I omitted the lime slices and added peaches which was super yummy. Instead of sugar I used honey and sweetened lime juice instead which gave it a nice flavor. Next time I think I'm going to try using Oporto instead of Cabernet and then it will have the natural sweetness of the wine. This was a huge success, I would recomment it to anyone!
I made this recipe twice and both times it was a hit!! Once at my housewarming and it was the first thing gone!! Again for a friendly dinner and my friend absolutely loved it!
I think this is a five-star sangria, but I would recommend using a good wine. My not-so-good wine made it more like a 3-4 star sangria. Oops!

This was a big hit at our thanksgiving dinner. We made a double double batch, used red table wine in a box and added a bit more liquor. Everyone loved it and knew which drink was theirs by which combo of fruit was in their glass.
I make this when ever my gal pals come over for a night of fun.

This recipe is great and oh so easy! I made mine with Razz Rum instead of Brandy, used Merlot wine and rasp lemonade concentrate. People were looking for more after it was gone! I cannot wait to make it again.
I never liked Sangria in the past, but when I tried this, it was unbelievable! I made a double batch and added 2 c of ginger ale. I forgot the cherries, though. Delicious!

I doubled this for a party and at the end of the evening not only was it all gone, but my friends were fishing out the fruit to eat. This recipe was so good I shared it with the clerk at the liquor store.
Everyone LOVES this sangria!! I omit the cherries and sugar, lighten up on the lemon juice, add peaches and top off with ginger ale. Absolutely perfect!!
We soaked the fruit in brandy and some wine overnight and they added a real kick!
My friends always request this for book club! I don't change a thing.

Very Good! Everyone loved this. I doubled the recipe and used it two days in a row adding diet sprite just before serving. I will definately make again. 2010 Update: I have been making this for several years now and everyone I serve it to loves it. I use a 3 Liter bottle of Chianti & quadruple the recipe for a big crowd. I always make it the day before and leave out the sugar, and add clear american black cherry carbonated water from walmart at the last minute. If there is any leftover it last several weeks.
Crisp and refreshing. It went down a little TOO well....

We made this recently for a pool party and it was a hit. Everyone enjoyed it. We didn't wait the 2 hours before drinking it and it was still very good. We used Merlot wine and rum (had it on hand). We will make this again and again.

Easy and delicious...everyone wanted the recipe. I omitted the sugar and cherries and didn't dilute with seltzer or club soda. To a batch made with chardonnay, I added the lemonade concentrate, and to a merlot batch I used the limeade concentrate. Yummy.
Fantastico !! This was great, and so simple ! I used Merlot, and doubled the batch for a dinner party. Thanks for the GREAT recipe ! :)
A wonderful base recipe for improvisation. I used a cabernet for the wine, used lime juice instead of the lemonade concentrate and added 5 cloves before refrigerating overnight. - Delicious!
Fruity and refreshing, this Sangria is a wonderful drink. I followed the recipe exactly except I left the cherries out.
This Sangria was great! I used the sugar and ginger ale and it was perect - got rave reviews at my party. I threw in some green apple chuncks too.
